Reviews.Title: “It's for you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's self was ok never the less we made the most of it there was 6 of us stayed for 2nights Easter time we had read the reviews before coming but thought listen let's just see for ourselves and was met by great staff they were so friendly with us and couldn't do enough for us all, the room was a bit small, bathroom big which was a bonus the sheets were clean fresh towels every day safe in room also a bonus abit 2 high to reach and very easy 2 leave things in it, breakfast not good need 2 improve there, great location very central and easy 2 find your way back. I think it's the luck of the draw I never seen any bed bugs etc and thank god I didn't as I would have been out. Would recommend for a couple of nites max.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: leeguapo
Reviews.Content: Good points Absolutely central to this over priced boring city Great powerful showers with plenty of hot water Rooms were lovely and warm. Staff friendly and helpful Bad points Very basic hotel...not for the squeemish. Basic breakfast Poor quality coffee The whole place felt dirty Walls are thin so you can here everything in the next room Amsterdam Over priced Â£8 per pint...Â£15 basic meal Boring and wouldnt go again.

Reviews.Title: “For Stag's only!”
Reviews.Author: McGuinness574
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel simply for the location which is perfect for all the main tourist attractions, RLD, Anne Frank, Dam etc etc We had read the reviews but still chose to book it - never again. Will suit men on stag do's but not couples and certainly not families. It looks extremely tatty and dirty on the outside and when you walk through the corridor there is a distinct smell of something weird but cannot place it, some of the receptionists also smoked just outside the door and the smoke wafted in and up the stairs. The receptionists are extremely nice and very very helpful, althought the staff within the restaurant part were quite sullen and never said "good morning". The complimentary breakfast was adequate with toast, boiled eggs, cooked meats, cheese, cereals, scrambled eggs, baked beans and bacon but the bacon was awful. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the external emergency exit stairs. The room was very shabby and dated with dubious stains on the carpet. We had to fix the toilet seat back on as it had slipped off the hooks. There was dust on the top of the curtains and tops of pictures and bed frame which had me sneezing all the time. The duvet was very thin as was the pillows and you only get 1 each! The mattress was also thin but didn't seem overly uncomfortable. There was no kettle in the room so good job I always take a travel kettle. This hotel was not cheap at Â£70+ per night but really we were paying for the good location rather than the hotel's facilities. No way is this hotel a 3* more like a minus 3*. Don't come here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel, won't stay if they offered it for free.”
Reviews.Author: Gihan1
Reviews.Content: This is beyond the worst hotel I've been at, I only thought this happens in movies. The room was infested with bed bugs, the staff are unfriendly and extremely rude. Once my partner and I switched off the lights all the bed begs started crawling all over the bed and they were every where. The staff member advised that he can not do anything and all he can do is change the sheets! Bed bugs crawle in my ear and my ear was bleeding all night. I booked in another hotel the same night. This absolutely ruined our holiday, give me ear infection and bed bug phobia. This is redicilous and unacceptable by any means. I really doubt of I can come back to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to put your head down!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie-Jay C
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was quite worried about the mice. Well there was nothing to be worried about, I travelled with my three friends we're all aged between 20-23 and stayed here for two nights. The location is absolutely fantastic! The staff we're polite and friendly, we didn't have to pay a 25 Euro deposit instead we just gave card details, all very secure though may I add. We stayed in one of the quad rooms just four single beds. All we wanted the hotel for was to sleep so it was perfect! It is quite noisey if you get a room on the front of the hotel so if your a light sleeper take ear plugs. The breakfast was just average not amazing but did the trick and saves money and effort going and finding somewhere to eat so early in the morning. All in all I would stay in this hotel again. There was nothing wrong with it, hope to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “It did the job!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the delta for 3 nights in February. Our room was clean, the towels were changed daily and the room was warm, staff were friendly. It is a run down hotel, but you get for what you pay for, We have no complaints at all. The restaurant downstairs was clean, the buffet breakfast was nice and the restaurant staff also very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our trip”
Reviews.Author: Balls16
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay as a group of 8 lads on a 'Dutch Dash' and it was perfect for what we needed. A base to leave the bags and somewhere clean to sleep. I didn't sample the food, but would have no qualms about booking here for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: R S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel Delta is a very basic hotel. I was put off by the dirty old exterior and inside the reception area was not much better. However the staff and the location are the best I have come across in Amsterdam. Views of Dam Sq, the red light district and much more all from your hotel window and frankly when in the Amsterdam spirit (after a coffee shop or too!) the hotel delta seemed a good place to be. Quick, convenient and best of all they keep your luggage until home time and as they are right next to the station it's only two minutes on your journey!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not clean, modern and functional”
Reviews.Author: Davelad2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not three stars! First room i was given had no windows and two large boxes covering holes which led outside with freezing cold air. I was moved to another room but this was rundown, bathroom was no bigger that a shoebox. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can NOT find a fault with this place.”
Reviews.Author: JamesWils0n
Reviews.Content: I took my 73 year old mother on a much needed break last week, and was anxious about the negative reviews that I saw after I had booked it. Within 2 minutes of arrival, we were both made to feel very welcome by John behind the counter. The room itself was small, but spotlessly clean, and they gave us exactly what we requested on booking. As for the breakfast, the "cold" breakfast included HOT baked beans, scrambled eggs and bacon - as much as we could eat. It also included cereals, fruit, yoghurt, orange juice and toast, as well as a cold meat & cheese selection. I'm lost about what anyone would find fault with this as it's included in the price. All the staff were helpful, and above all, friendly and welcoming. I came over from Glasgow, and have stayed in dumps and 5 star hotels. When I next come back to Amsterdam, I'm not going to look beyond this hotel when making my booking. I completely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, shame about the mice!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne H
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel before we travelled but tried to keep an open mind! First and foremost, the hotel's best feature is it's location! This was the reason we booked it and the hotel could not be better situated or easier to find. We arrived from the airport by train and it was just a couple of minutes walk from the station, and centrally located for everything else. The staff were friendly and helpful, and as mentioned in previous reviews we did have to pay a â‚¬25 deposit when we checked in. I found it strange that we were asked to hand in our room key to reception every time we left the hotel and had to ask for it back on our return. But it didn't cause any problems. Our double room (107 on the first floor) was shabby looking and dated as I had expected from reading the reviews. That didn't worry me too much though. The room was a generous size and was at the front of the hotel directly above the main entrance. There was a lot of street noise......if you were a light sleeper you'd maybe want to ask for a quieter room, but I'm not and we enjoyed being able to see what was going on in the busy street outside. The TV had a good choice of English language channels, and the free Wi-Fi (which is only supposed to work in the public areas) worked in our room too, so that was a plus. The bathroom was clean and functional, and the shower was hot and extremely powerful - but the shower head was hung far to high on the wall for most people! Luckily my husband is 6'5" and could get it down for me - I could never have reached it myself! Towels were changed daily, and shower gel, handwash and hairdryer are provided in the bathroom too. Breakfast was basic. There wasn't much choice, but what there was was sufficient to fill you up for the morning, and staff were constantly replenishing the food so nothing ever ran out, even when we were among the last ones in for breakfast. Now.........the mice!! We didn't take food in our room, but they still came looking for it! I'm not particularly squeamish about things like that, and didn't think the odd mouse would bother me. But it wasn't just the odd one.......you could hear them scratching about in the room all night long, and I have to admit even I was a bit freaked out by it! Would I stay here again? If it wasn't for the mice, yes. If you're lucky enough to get a room without any, this is a friendly, well priced hotel for the location. But the mice were a step too far for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jaineee
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful; both during my stay and before (phone calls, emails, etc.). I was on the 4th floor and there was a lift which was a godsend... its slow, but it works!! The room I had was very small but the bathroom was massive. They were both very clean. The window was small and the people below us could climb out of their window and in through mine because of this weird terrace type structure. This was very concerning as it made sleeping with the window open very uncomfortable and it was a small room in mid summer and that was the only ventilation. Great location. EVERYTHING WAS NEARBY!! OMG....their restaurant is great!! By far the best meal I had on my 2 day trip and I went on Â£75pp dinner cruise which was nice. Reasonable price too. I never had the breakfast but my husband said it was great. Overall, great trip and great hotel. If you get the right room you cannot go wrong. Definitely would recommend and go back.

Reviews.Title: “BAD HOTEL BED BUG BITES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie W
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed for 3 nights Nov 11, we had insect bites by 2nd night, by the 3rd night biten really bad, didnt realise this was in fact due to bed bug bites at the time as never had a bed bug problem before, we found 2 bugs in the bed, however didnt realise this was bed bug's!! we have both been biten at least 50 each, this is disgusting!!! still 5 days back in UK still really itchy and using medication for this problem, we never had this problem before when we stayed Nov 10. This is unsatsifactory at 95 euro's a night!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, right in the heart of the Centrum”
Reviews.Author: Andy_C99
Reviews.Content: Had read the reviews on the internet, only after booking. Was apprehensive prior to the visit. We have no problem in locating the hotel, and check in was easy. The service staff was very courteous and prompt. However, we have to pay 10 euros for some tax (not sure what it is), and 25 euros deposit (for phone calls). The bedroom assigned was reasonable in size (compared to other hotels in Amsterdam). But the mattresses for both beds were too worn out and soft! We literally sank into the mattress. TV programmes are available in various languages. We were surprised that there were also two programmes from CCTV (China), one in Chinese, while the other in English. Generally, the overall experience is good, and it would be much better if the mattresses can be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located but tatty”
Reviews.Author: Hungry_Hippo_UK
Reviews.Content: Location location location must be the key to the pricing here because I couldn't see how this hotel can justify charging 60 Euros a night for a single room that wasn't any better than any of the hostels you can find dotted around Amsterdam. I was most aggrieved at check in when I was informed the credit/debit card machine had broken and if I wanted to continue the reservation I'd have to pay cash. After carefully planning how much cash I'd needed to bring with me (and hence getting best exchange rates and paying minimum commission) I was a bit cheesed off that I'd now have to withdraw cash from a foreign ATM and be hit with charges I hadn't planned for. No great problem, I know, but it was their manner that really grated me. Once through reception it becomes clear that they don't reinvest much in this hotel. The carpets were torn and dirty, stairs wonky, rooms patchy and no curtain. Someone's obviously making a lot of money out of this place. But, it's saving grace is that it is located half way up Damrak - 5 minutes from Centraal Station, 5 minutes from Dam Square, 5 minutes from the Red Light District, shopping precinct right behind. Okay if all you're after is somewhere to put your head down for the night and you're not exactly after the Ritz, but come on Delta - be a bit more realistic with your pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has MICE”
Reviews.Author: terry p
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel me and my friends had ever stayed in the was 10 of us had an 8 man room and a 2 man room. the beds were not cleaned proply they only flip the sheets and give you new towels there was damp on the wall and to top it off the room had MICE we found mouse traps and mouse POSION and they dont want you take take food in the room the only hotel iv ever known to be like that and if you do you will lose your deposit but now we know why. the mice had eaten threw a pack of my mates chrips/chips. will never use this hotel again and i go twice a year. for 95euros a night you should not have mice in your room DO NOT USE whatever the price or deal worst hotel EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffbury
Reviews.Content: The Delta is situated in a very central position which is always a good thing when staying in a city. I had read some of the reviews which were poor, but only stayed in this hotel because we were meeting friends who had already booked. Our room had grubby carpets and net curtains and the curtains that were coming off the rails. However the bed linen was clean and the bed comfortable. We stayed at the back of the hotel which was over the kitchens but it was quiet and the bathroom was clean. The staff on the desk were friendly but the hotel is tatty and well past it's sell-by date, it reminded me of student accomodation, so at around 95 euros a night it seemed expensive. The seats in reception were very stained and breakfast was the poorest I'd ever had in a hotel before. Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night... Hotel was nice enough. Good price, lift that worked. Rooms in back are quiet. Breakfast in adjacent restaurant, but we slept in and missed that!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: what a hotel run-down tiny room, window opened into a concrete court yard where people smoked and talked into the early morning, so unable to open the window for fresh air with out smoke wafting into the room and the noise keeping you awake all night breakfast in the morning was the worst i have ever had coffee was like dont know hard to explain and food well we went out for breakfast after that left out luggage in the luggage room on the last day and yes they lost the key so had to wait until a replacement found stressful when you have a flight to catch would not recommended this hotel to anyone if your thinking about it LOOK FOR ANOTHER HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in my room and overflowing shower - No full refund provided”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyCustomer527
Reviews.Content: Yes the title is correct - there was a mouse in my room and a shower that overflowed everyday into the bedroom and on one occassion leaked into the bedroom below mine. On a daily basis during my stay, I informed reception that the shower was overflowing and I was told each time that it had been fixed only to find it overflowing again the next time the shower was used. As if this stay was not bad enough, a mouse ran across the bedroom floor causing me to complain to reception. The response I got was "just one question - did you have food in your room?" I was outraged by this, as I had not had food in my room but had witnessed each day during our stay, the cleaning staff having their breakfast/lunch in the cleaning storgae room just a few doors down from our room. This hotel refused to move me to another room and advised me that I was entitled to a refund due to the endless issues that I'd experienced. This was just the start of a bad customer service journey...... Even though I'd paid for the stay in cash, the hotel demanded bank details to allow them to transfer the money directly into my account, with I provided. Two weeks after my stay, the refund that still not been tranferred into my account. I contact the hotel by email and then had to telephone to get an answer about the refund. I was then told by the hotel to provide them with my credit card number for the refund to provided and yet again I provided them with my details and guess what.... three days later the refund had still not been placed on my credit card causing me to telephone the hotel once again. This time they informed me that they would transfer the money today - refunding one nights stay! I had stayed for three nights in this hotel and was expecting a full refund after such a terrible stay. . Each day that passed during my stay went from bad to worse and I've never left a hotel review before but felt I had to inform others about my experience and hope that someone knows who to contact to make sure that this hotel is investigated. This hotel is the worst hotel i've ever had the misfortune to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but Mice”
Reviews.Author: ReiseCarson
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is in the perfect - i repeat, perfect - location. The staff is nice, the breakfast buffet (in the restaurant next door) is good, the rooms are clean and the price is very reasonable. No bedbugs (we checked two rooms) The hotel rules state that you should not bring food to the rooms, but on our second night in Amsterdam we got drunk and forgot. We brought some croissants up with us and one of them was left in a bag on the floor. Within an hour I woke up from strange sounds and discovered three small mice running around on the floor and on the desk. They kept me up most of the night, messing about in our luggage and scratching inside the walls... The next day, we went to the reception and told them what had happened. They seemed genuinely sorry and gave us a new room on the top floor right away (551). Very helpful and apologetic, and there were no mice in the new room. Overall, I do reccommend this hotel, but DO NOT bring food back to your room. And if you can, avoid room 334 (that's where we had mice)

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice and tidy, well presented room. We stayed in the 8 bed room and found it perfect for our needs. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “hotel delta amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: impy69
Reviews.Content: stayed here 22nd september till 27th september, situated on the damrak the main street in amsterdam this hotel is well placed for everything the boat trips,shopping, tram station,plus a tourist office about 50metres away should you wish to book days out. a little dated but a tidy well run hotel.towels were changed daily and every room is different.not for the long stay but pleasant enough for a few days. no food or visitors are allowed in your rooms.but it does have a lift,if you have ever climbed stairs in an amsterdam hotel you will know what i mean.

Reviews.Title: “Use as a Transit Hotel only”
Reviews.Author: MNDH
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel was the perfect solution for a transit night. My 2 children (11, 12) and I arrived quite late at Schipol (10.30pm), managed to easily navigate the tickets and platforms for the subway to Amsterdam Centraal (approx. 20 mins) and then walk a fairly direct route to the Delta Hotel (print out a google map before you go as it's hard to see the road names). Outside of the hotel was a bit of an eye-opener for the kids but the 'bigger' action is directly across the canal. The lovely fellow on the desk was waiting for us and our triple room was perfectly adequate for a quick sleep. This room/bathroom is nothing flash so please don't expect it to be. The floors were uneven and the room with triple beds squeezy BUT it was clean. The breakfast next morning offered enough variety to keep us all happy. Other useful info: there is a small lift which was a lifesaver; there is free wi-fi in the lobby but it also worked in our 1st level room; and, lastly, don't leave your luggage in the luggage room. We checked out next morning but I wanted to do some sightseeing with the kids. We crazily thought that we'd leave the 3 pieces of luggage + 1 backpack in the almost empty luggage room. 3 hours later, we went to pick them up only to find that this small room was jammed to bits. I literally had to empty most of the room, take out my luggage and then re-pack. One child was nearly murdered though when she asked where her backpack was!!! (yes, I had forgotten about it and had to do it all over again!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pleasant - and great location”
Reviews.Author: katiefox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bed room in the attic. It was clean, spacious with adequate storage. A decent bathroom with plenty of hot water. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The inclusive breakfast was standard and fairly basic, but perfectly adequate. On our first night we ate in the restaurant which was fine - not fancy but tasty. The 15% discount was even better! We were a bit worried before we went by some of the reviews, but after having stayed there, I do wonder what some people's expectations are! It isn't luxurious, and yes the stair carpet was worn in places, but I would strongly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced and very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Bigal3
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel is located right in the Centre of Damrak convenient for all of Amsterdam's attractions. I stayed there for 2 nights and having stayed in the middle of Amsterdam many times before, this is one of the better hotels. The stairs are not as steep as many are, due to the compactness of the buildings and there was a lift, although it had only 3 walls on it. You had to keep back from the door as it was rising and falling. Not a propblem however and a very minor criticism. The rooms are small as I suspected, but mine ( and my colleagues) were very clean and made up each day. En-suite was clean and small of course, but okay. There is a wet floor, which means when you shower the whole bathroom is flooded! Again not a problem if you are used to this. Breakfast buffet was everything one would expect from a Dutch Hotel. Continental cuisine with lots of fresh bread, croissants, fruit juices etc and superb coffee, the way I like it. If all you want is bacon and eggs, then they cater for that as well, although the bacon looked a trifle fatty.. All in all a good breakfast and a very large dining room with lots of seating areas. Staff very helpful and excellent security with a free safe in each room and programmable key cards for the room doors. Also 24hour front door service so you can come and go any time of the day or night. I would finally say that if you are looking for a Hotel right in the centre of Amsterdam and you are on a medium budget, then the Delta Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: kleaneasy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a girlâ€™s mini break, arriving before check in the staff were happy to store our cases until our room was ready. We stayed in a large room on the first floor sleeping 7; there was a reasonable amount of space for the number of beds, with a large door/window which opened onto the main street. The room and beds were clean and as we were only staying a few nights we all left our cloths in our baggage, if you were staying longer you might have problems with storage space but the room was large enough to keep a case by each bed without trouble. The bathroom was very large and also clean. There were other large single sex groups in the hotel during our stay but we didnâ€™t notice any issues with noise. The hotel lift is very small and cramp as is the access point to it. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast (when we were awake in time) which was a typical continental buffet. We also ate on the last night, frankly if we had on the first night we wouldnâ€™t have eaten anywhere else. The food was stunning, good size portions and excellent value for money. This isnâ€™t a hotel to stay if youâ€™re looking for any kind of luxury, but it is clean, perfectly located within easy reach of Central Station, the Red Light District, public transport etc. I would stay again is travelling with friends, but not with children.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scona81
Reviews.Content: location is perfect near everything we needed, red light district food, dam square. room was clean enough and small but perfect for people not spending all day in your room. staff were more than helpful and the included buffet breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Average place for not so average price”
Reviews.Author: Buketcicek
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a nice location- just opposite the red light district and Chinese part of the city, but you should certainly not expect luxury stay. The room we were in was clean, but everything inside looked a bit old. The staff was excellent. Before the trip I was told to look for a hotel with a better rating for the same price, but I'd definitely do it if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE< GREAT LOCATION < WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: VanessaCalgaryGal
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone to Amsterdam and found that this hotel was perfect for what I was looking for. Now - what was I looking for? - I wanted a private bathroom, clean, relatively quiet, secure and within walking distnace of everything - and I found it! Staff was great and very helpful. Rooms are small but standard for single hotel rooms in Europe - beds were bvery comfortable! I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: english_muffinHull
Reviews.Content: My partner had booked us in for one night and having read previous reviews was dreading staying there. How ever my fears where groundless. This hotel is 5 minutes from the central station so very quick and easy to find. The staff where friendly enough although the 25 euro deposit for the key was a suprise as this was not mentioned previously. The deposit was returned to us in full on checking out. Our room was at the back of the hotel so our view was limited to roof tops. However it was very quite. The bathroom was clean with fresh towels for us. The room it's self was a bit tired looking, but the bedding was clean and fresh. We had a meal in the adjoining resturant and got 15% discount on the food as we where staying at the hotel. The resturant was clean and the food cooked to order. The hotel is located on the main road to the Dam and not far from the red light district. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Amsterdam but this hotel was awful!”
Reviews.Author: Gina W
Reviews.Content: Great location and good view from room but that was all I am afraid. The room was very basic and in need of refurbishment. There was a step into the bathroom which was dangerous and we tripped over it several times. The room was infested with fleas and bedbugs, we got several bites during our stay. Guests are promised 15% off food puchased in the restaurant for lunch and dinner, but this was not reimbursed despite our complaints. Noisy partygoers allowed to congregate outside hotel in early hours and not moved on by hotel staff despite guests being told to be quiet after 22.00hours.

Reviews.Title: “Will newer come back”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_copenhagen
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty when we arrived. The cleaned it after we complained. Furthermore we forgot two jacket (our mistake), but I called the reception the same afternoon, but the jackets was gone. No one other than the cleaning staff was in the room...... The leason learned. Dont forget anything when you leave the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: HITESHSADH
Reviews.Content: Delta is all about location Restaurants & food courts downstairs Shopping district behind the hotel & Clubs Bars RLD , Dam square in 5 mins walking. very nice staff. walkable from station. Good breakfast. wifi only available in the lobby & select rooms but its free.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel staff are very helpful. will be going back”
Reviews.Author: phillips25
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the delta hotel on 26th june 2011 for 2 nights. we arrived in amsterdam too early to check-in into our hotel so we asked reception if we could leave our bags behind the desk he said yes told us to come back to check if we could be in our room before 2oclock we headed back about half 1 got booked in we were on the 4th floor 449 room not much of a view but room was really clean beds were very clean bathroom was too. shower worked fine fresh towels and beds made up every morning. the service at the front desk was very helpful and happy to deal with anything. we had a lovely stay at the delta hotel and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattyb16
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on here i was apprehensive about a 3 day stay here with my brother we payed around 35 euro pppn and really enjoyed staying here no troubles room was clean and tidy no hiccups yes we were charged a city tax on arrival 18.50 euro which i didnt fully understand but this is amsterdam and everything was pricey so i didnt feel too hard done by,the location for exploring the dam is as close as your gonna get ideal for when you crawl out of a coffee shop and need to ly down for a minute or two,like i say i was a bit sketched before arriving after reading reviews but in all honesty found it difficult to find any negatives...well done delta hotel you helped my break in amsterdam run smoothly and we would love to return again soon thanks.....

Reviews.Title: “VILE”
Reviews.Author: willhove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ABSOLUTELY DREADFUL, I dont know how it gets a three star rating it should be three scull and cross bones with a hazzard warning on the door. The room are filthy and non of the appliances work ie. bed lamp, shower, sink etc. Breafast is also a disaster, not enough food to go round and cold coffee. But worst of all when all other hotels are very busy this place doubles its prices! As for the location, it is very central but in a horible area. *******DO NOT STAY HERE*******you have been warned

Reviews.Title: “BUGS, RUDE”
Reviews.Author: alexstar8a
Reviews.Content: We Booked this place on: October 2, 2010, Booking ID: 9608984870, our check in May 13 at 10:00pm, price 396 EUROS (NOT A CHEAP PLACE FOR WHAT IT IS) We went out for dinner with friends and came back at 2:00am, at 4:00am I woke up with a horrible rush turned lights on and there were bugs all over the place. My neck, Forehead and Arm were bitten and swollen, immediately went down to the front desk and the guy working there seemed to be embarrssed, he said that the person in charge came at 8:00am and there were no rooms available so we could not change our room and could not give us our money back, so we decided not to go back to the room, my wife was terrified and sat at a chair until 10:00am when finally this lady in charge showed up. She was rude and refused to give us our money back until I threatened to go to the police and show them the video and pictures of the bugs walking all over the sheets, mattress and carpet. then in a bad manner she took the phone called someone and gave us our money. after all we were happy to leave this place and stayed at the Sheraton Schiphol and slept all day at their beautiful sweet sleeper beds with no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Bare basic flop house”
Reviews.Author: jib71
Reviews.Content: If you just want a bed, four walls, a TV and a shower near the red light district - and you're not fussy about cleanliness - this might meet your minimum expectations. But for most people, this hotel will feel like really roughing it. I paid >$200 to stay one night in an eight person room ( unfortunately the only available room in Amsterdam that night). Positive points - Friendly receptionist. Convenient location for Amsterdam Centraal station and seedy areas of downtown - if that's what you want (red light district and coffee shops). I would say this is an OK flop house for a group of frat house types who just want to be close to the red light district and coffee shops. Sharing a room between eight will minimize costs - as long as you don't care about any degree of amenities and you're not fussy about cleanliness.. The shower was good, albeit a little scary - scalding water at ENORMOUS pressure. I stood outside the shower area to adjust the temperature and once I got it to a comfortable temperature I have to say it was an invigorating way to start the day. Negative points - A grimy room. Most fittings in the room were in a state of disrepair. Lighting was rudimentary - a ceiling light at the entrance of the room and a bare bulb on one wall. There were two table lamps with no bulbs in them. Impossible to work in the room because the lack of working electric power outlets made it impossible to plug in a PC and have a light on at the same time. There is no WiFi working in the room. The bed sheets appeared to be fresh but very threadbare (holes in a few places). Curtains and net curtains were blackened after exposure over years to fumes from the street, I guess. The wooden floor appeared to have been swept, but I found plastic cups and litlte bits of trash that had been left behind by previous occupants . Location is rowdy and noisy until the early hours of the morning - not suitable if you want a good night's rest. There's no soap, shampoo etc. The hotel provides a few scratchy, threadbare towels. Restaurant - The restaurant downstairs serves an adequate free breakfast - some low grade bread, some cereal, a tray of soggy bacon and a tray of dried out scrambled egg. Don't go there for an evening meal. The service is odd - not allowing single travelers to take a large table, even though the place is 75% empty and not offering "lunch" items like omelete in the evening. (I don't want to eat a steak just before going to bed, thank you... ). Amazingly, the kitchen managed to botch an order of spaghetti and salad - Ridiculously overcooked pasta and a watered down sauce from a tin, I think. Awful. But I guess food is not Amsterdam's strong point, in general.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers > Delta Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boyds_TSB
Reviews.Content: $200 per night for a room. Caked on mould in the bathroom. No eating allowed in your room. No air conditioning. Not being able to open your windows because your rooms above a tram line...priceless! TRAVELLERS BEWARE!!! Sleep on the streets if you have to!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, will be booking to go again”
Reviews.Author: alic30
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed in the 8 person room over the weekend. Upon arrival at the hotel we were a good few hours before the 2pm check in time, we were able to leave our cases with reception and were advised that if we came back around dinner time we may be able to check in to the room early. We went back around 12.30, and sure enough our room was ready. The room although basic was just what we required, it was at the front of the hotel and the balcony was facing the main street. Location of the hotel was ideal, right across the road from the famous red light district and in the thick of coffee shops, restaurants and bars. The guy on the reception was very friendly and helpfull and even recommended where to go for a decent curry (Ghandi's) down the road from the hotel. Cannot fault the hotel at all, breakfast was just what we required and been able to leave our cases before and after check in/out, meant we were able to relax and enjoy the sights. Ignore all the negative comments on here, clearly they are expecting a 5* hotel but at the prices the rooms are, you know it is not going to be the case. We will be back, and will probably stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Incorrect info re this hotel”
Reviews.Author: remfan
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed as I had previously emailed the hotel to inform them of my disability as in steps are difficult for me. They allocated me a room on 3rd floor down 3 steep steps. Health and safety issue if there had been a fire when unable to use a lift. A party of young males were checking in before me and 2 of them were allocated a triple room with balcony on the first floor. I feel my request for a room without stair access was ignored. My request for a room change was refused and a subsequent email sent to the management whilst I was there received no response. This is not good customer care. I feel the girl who dealt with me on reception and allocated the rooms was not bothered. There is also an issue about the advertised wifi throughout the hotel. This is NOT the case. The staff roll out the excuse that they cannot deal with the wifi but it is accessible in the restaurant. This excuse seemed well practised. Another American guest in a first floor room told me he had been told the same and he could not access the "wifi" from the first floor either. However the restaurant staff were very pleasant and helpful. The housekeeping too was fine as the room was well looked after and I have no complaints at all re that. It was an interior room with a window looking out 1 metre to another wall. Without much natural light it wasn't the best room to allocate to a disabled person who would spend time there resting in between trying to see the city. The position of the hotel is what sells it to visitors I suspect and consequently the management does not have to try too hard. I think there is a great deal of difference between the room quality and one has to play pot luck as to which room one is allocated (with the young blond receptionist it might be more favourable to be a young male for example) Can highly recommend Der Klos for dining.... Kerkstraat 41 in between the flower market and leidsplein. This was a return visit and is the best place I have ever eaten ribs! Good idea to purchase the bus and entrance ticket to the Keukenhof. â‚¬21 = a good deal Bus goes from

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: tonycrane
Reviews.Content: this has got to be one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at and i have stayed in some poor hotels- they advertise "family rooms" but what they really mean is rooms to fit a group of men out for a party weekend. the rooms were unclean with cigarette ends on the floor, the furniture was damaged and well worn and the carpets were disgusting. i spent around 15 minutes there then left and found another hotel.i would not let my wife and kids stay there or anybody elses wife or kids for that matter. the street is noisy with rooms above a chip shop and on a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT.. HAD AMAZING TIME HOTEL FAB!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonesefc
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve just returned from the delta hotel stayed for 2 nights, i was worrying so much before we arrived as had a lot of bad reviews, well how wrong are the people who said that.... do not listen to them. This hotel was amazing, yes basic but what do people expect for the price, cheap and cheerful! The hotel is in a great location, a few mins walk to everywhere, looking out over the canal too which was lovely! The staff in the hotel are so friendly too.. advised us were to go and advised that Amsterdam is save but there is pick pockets like any city, which was nice, he remembered our names every time we came back from being out, gave us a free map of the city. the reception is open 24 hours which was great someone was always there if you needed them also when we checked out at 11 we didnâ€™t have to leave until 12 so we had a last little look around Amsterdam and they kept our cases safe behind the reception desk!! Our room was on the 4th floor looking out to the road and canal, room was basic, but was very clean thatâ€™s all you need as you are never in your room only to sleep in! Rooms were a good size, bath room was massive good size for 3 girls all getting ready! There was no rats as other people have said in there reviews we didnâ€™t see one so donâ€™t know what they are on about!!!! Our room was cleaned once over the 2 nights we stayed with was great didnâ€™t expect that, new bedding and clean towels! You get a free breakfast in the hotelâ€™s restaurant, this was great and was free, you could also get money off if you ate there lunch and dinner, we never did but was always busy!! Couldnâ€™t ask for a better hotel this made our Amsterdam experience even better having somewhere safe and clean to stay in! Really was great thanks hotel delta for a fantastic stay!! Will be returning and without doubt recommend to friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than some reviews suggest! Worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: zippy082
Reviews.Content: Ok. I have just got back from spending 8 days in Amsterdam. I stumbled upon this hotel through easyjet as my normal hotel was fully booked plus the Delta hotel was a lot cheaper and much much more central to what i wanted. We arrived on an early flight and were prepared to take all of our bags around the city until check-in. This was not the case though as the receptionist told us he would mind them for us which was a bonus. Also, he informed us that due to our length of stay that we had been upgraded. We were on the 4th floor, room 440, a big, spacious room, more than enough storage space. There was also a mini balcony. Not the type that you sit out side in but big windws that opened in so you could sit there and watch the day go by., I only managed to get breakfast 3 times whilst i was there but it wasn't bad. I didn't like the scrambled eggs and their bacon was too over cooked for me. The continental is ok though. I'd also eaten dinner in the resturant a few times and the steak was done perfect. Overall, a good, cheap hotel. Fresh towels daily, polite staff and a very good location. Will be back in 2012! Just need to remeber to bring a kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: adrienne24
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights last weekend with my friend they allocated us a twin en-suite room on the 4th floor with view of Dam street below. I can't complain to be honest. We were provided with towels, the shower had hot water, the room was warm and there was a hairdryer in the bathroom. This is a basic 2/3 star hotel don't expect the Ritz but it cannot be beaten when it comes to location. Also compared to other hotels nearby the price was very resonable and the best part was a smoking room! Lovely :)

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: signorwhippy
Reviews.Content: I really cant believe the majority of the reviews for this hotel?! Stayed there for 2 nights and couldnt fault the place one bit. Arrived in amsterdam about 11am and went and dropped off our bags which were kept safe by the person on reception who was very polite and professional. If you are nice and polite you get the same back, never caught his name but he was very good. Came back at 2 and our room was ready. We got room 440 which was very spacious and very clean. The view was also very good. We were allowed to smoke in the room as long as we opened the windows to do so. We tried the breakfast on the first day and it had everything you would expect like eggs, bacon, beans etc. Was nothing spectacular but I was there to explore amsterdam, not camping in the hotel and freeloading. We paid Â£117 for the room which for a city as expensive as amsterdam was really good value for money, the breakfast was just a bonus if we wanted it. The location is spot on. Manneken pis next door for the best chips ever, round the corner is de kuil and a very good dutch bakery as well as a wok to walk and cracking burger bar which always has queues outside the door! Was the ideal location to explore. We did heineken experience, amsterdam dungeon and canal boat ride which were all very accesible from our hotel. To sum it up: was dreading it considering the reviews I had read but this hotel exceeded my expectations and more. Bravo delta!

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the most disgusting hotel that I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: keithhart1948
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel as recommended on the Easyjet website. The room was filthy, the common areas shabby, staff were rude and unhelpful and breakfast poor. This is not an experience that I would wish to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS RAT INFESTED HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: london_location_2011
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend anyone to stay at the Delta Hotel... during the night you hear rats in your room ratling around in your bags. The shower room/toilet was discusting.. the shower curtain was liturally touching the toilet. My advise would be to avoid this hotel like the plague. Only plus side of the hotel was the location, but even that doesn't make up for the discusting rat infested hotel. Also another point to be aware of is that EVERY TIME you leave the hotel you have to LEAVE YOUR ROOM KEY WITH THE RECEPTIONIST and don't know who goes into your room when you are not there. Breakfast.. don't even bother it was the most discusting food I have ever tasted. I wouldn't even rate this hotel as a 1 star let alone 3. Bed sheets and towels were dirty. This hotel needs to be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for everything - just don't expect 4* luxury”
Reviews.Author: Wotnohair
Reviews.Content: Ten of us stayed on 8th December 2010 at this hotel and we found it to be clean and comfortable. Look past the worn out carpets and the fact that you pay on arrival (including a refundable deposit) and this place is top value for money. We stayed on the 5th floor (the lift only goes to the 4th) and it was quiet, though we were out most of the night. The shower is a hoot as there's no shower curtain so when you turn it on it sprays the whole bathroom. The breakfast was good, fruit juice, hot bacon, eggs, beans, toast, fresh fruit and yoghurt. Coffee and tea on tap. The laugh was the guests queuing up to use the two slice toaster. Lots of passing trade came in for breakfast so that sums it up as far as I'm concerned. Cheap cheerful accomodation in the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: jackiekennedy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were asked our payment for our to be made in full, this made me suspisious. We were then shown to our room which was a bit of a treck up and down stairs (we would be in trouble if there was a fire) and we were shown our room which was like a bunker with a window that opened out onto a wall the bathroom was horrible like something you would expect to see in an institution. I immediately asked for a room change as I couldn't sleep in a room without a window in the basement! We were moved to a room at the front of the hotel right over the Chip shop. I bought sheets and a pillow case because the sheets supplied were so dirty. The bathroom was ditry, it was a horrible place. I would not recommend this hotel and can't believe after all the negative comments that they wouldn't do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisabBlackpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotlessly clean, the reception were very friendly and helpful. Location spot on, right in the middle of everything.The room we had was very spacious and the bed was the comfiest i have ever slept in. Will definately be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: LindaRoss
Reviews.Content: Small but cleanish bedroom, though hotel generally could have done with a good scrub and lick of paint. Bath towels changed every day. Breakfast buffet selection adequate - 2 cereals and maybe one item of fruit if we were lucky. Cooked items of eggs, streaky bacon, baked beans every day and if it ran out - tough! Excellent location and staff friendly enough. We would go back as the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from room 111 !!!”
Reviews.Author: ancinimancini
Reviews.Content: OK, I know Amsterdam is an expensive capital when it comes to accomodation but this doesnt mean that the hotels must take advantage of your needs for sleep. i stayed at the Delta Hotel and paid 73 euros for one night. I would not complained if my room had at least two basic needs. One, a window (yes, ther was NO window in my room) and the other thing a second pillow. The room itself was clean and the shower was more than satisfactory but the size of the room reminded me my days when I was in the Navy with USS Seawolf (SSN-21) in Connecticut! VERY VERY VERY SMALL!!! Good thing about the hotel though is its location. Would I stay there again? If I'd get the room for cheaper, say 50 euros maybe, but NEVER AGAIN IN ROOM 111 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joogy93
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel is perfectly located for exploring all the sights of amsterdam. We stayed for 2 nights as a birthday treat...the staff were friendly , and had our room cleaned as we had arrived early.....The room was clean and the shower and toilet were spotless...considering what you pay and where it is located we thought it was good value for money....the breakfast is a typical hotel breakfast and was ok. Granted the rooms are a bit dated but for the money you could do worse. The Ritz its not but if you like cheap and cheerful then you should find the delta ok for you....one final word of warning, take plenty of spending money if you like a couple of drinks as the price are horrendous..........5 euros for a pint a and 6.50 euros for a half litre, wine was the same price....eating out is expensive too.....be warned........

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it!”
Reviews.Author: WordTraveller007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel few years ago (2006)for few nights. While we stayed there for 4 nights, the only good thing about the hotel was the location otherwise in 4 days. Our hotel room was robbed (passports/money everything gone) when enquired when we went to the room they said they had moved our stuff to the room next door. There were rats in the room. When checking out they were asking for money, obviously we didnâ€™t have any as our room had been cleaned out (looked like a inside job)

Reviews.Title: “TWO WORDS - BED BUGS ....”
Reviews.Author: lynzclapperton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta in 2004 and just happened to check it on here now ! Thought id share my thoughts - when we first arrived into our room we noticed straight away the bin had no bag in it we wouldnt have minded but the bin was so dirty and smelly and had obviously not been cleaned in a long time . Then on looking behind the radiator i found dirty tissues of what use i dont want to know , Very restless sleep as beds not comfy and hardly any covers , started itching on the first night and by the fourth ( our last thank god ) i had bites on my back from what i imagine to be bed bugs. Its a pity as the hotel itself is in a Great Location ....

Reviews.Title: “GO DELTA!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmckirgan
Reviews.Content: All these people that have been giving the Delta bad reviews, GET A GRIP!!!! We had a delightful stay, The staff where nothing but helpful. The room were perfect for what we paid for and for what we wanted. The beds were unbelievably comfy. We were able to smoke smelly produce thats found in Amsterdam in the room.(as long as your in a smoking room) This will be our choice of hotel the next time we go to Amsterdam as its optimum location is ideal for all the coffeshops,restraunt and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Restless night”
Reviews.Author: bananaman186337
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent clean and ok but there was a problem. I booked a twin bed room which was on my invoice yet they only had a double bedded room. I had to share a bed with another male friend (DJ) and due to the confined space his true feelings come out and i continually had to fight off his sexual advances.Eventually i managed to get some sleep but did have a dream about him tickling my balls........maybe he was we will never know .

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hell hole in the entire universe bar none”
Reviews.Author: pigster_10
Reviews.Content: OMG...I have never in my entire life stayed in a complete sh*t ho*e like this one. It is without doubt the WORST hotel in the ENTIRE world.... I stayed one night and ended up covered in bites....I thought I was having a bad dream when I thought I was covered in insects...I wasn't !! The worst was to come in the early morning when a large rat strutted over the bed....appearing to feed on the various bugs I was previously subjected to !! The breakfast looked ok...but 30 minutes later I was hurling into the filthy toilet. The staff were extremely rude and laughed about the rat...they said it was a pet called BASIL !! Dear god...I would rather sleep in a public toilet then this.....but....it's good for something to talk about !! ENJOY !!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Delta”
Reviews.Author: paulib32
Reviews.Content: What can I say everytime I go to Amsterdam, I end up staying at the Hotel Delta. So far been here 3 times in the last 6 months. So the hotel itself is what you would expect for a low star hotel, however the rooms are clean and tidy and you can have twins or the room of 10 that we did. The hotel is 5 minutes from the train station, and about the same if you go on the ferry from where the coach drops and picks up. From the train station the train to the airport is 10-15 minutes. Delta is where all the action is, evenly situated for shops, bars and the rest! Staff are very helpful and the website is very easy to use and book if you wish to book direct, all in all an excellent well priced little beauty!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money but just about OK”
Reviews.Author: Johnn123
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for this hotel for one night as we were stuck in Amsterdam. The location is great and the reception staff friendly. However the rooms were very poor for the money and did not appear that clean (though as there was very little natural light and very poor lighting it was hard to tell!!). Breakfast was from a buffet and we decided not to risk the rather dodgy looking hot stuff, the cold stuff was OK though basic.

Reviews.Title: “KIP”
Reviews.Author: sandraaw
Reviews.Content: Paid average enough price for city centre - not too cheap but an absolute rip off! Rooms stank, were really old fashioned, shower sprang from boiling to freezing, no bath not even a bath matt so bathroom flooded after wach shower.. Needed to request clean towels daily.. Have never been in a "hotel" soooo bad! Hostel it should be!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: VodkaQueenLeicester
Reviews.Content: I thought that if we had paid a good amount of money, the hotel would be good enough - wrong! We checked in and went into the room and the first thing I noticed was the horrible stained yellowy pillows! On our way out, I asked for new pillows for the room to be told 'oh, the laundry hasn't come back yet, so we had no pillowcases for your pillows, but we will put them on later!' Needless to say, for the two nights we were there, I used a folded up towel instead of a pillow. The floor felt like it would give way any minute, and the bathroom was incredibly small, the room was also cold and dingy. Breakfast was about the only highlight! Holland is one of my favourite countries, and I am sad that this hotel let me down a bit, but the hotel is situated on the Damrak and is in walking distance of anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “U get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: Shauneen44
Reviews.Content: As a person who likes there comfort and is a harsh reviewer, my boyfriend and i booked in here as a leisure trip, I had read all the reviews on the sites and that and I thought here we go, complaints galore, I was surprised to say the least, I found the staff very pleasant and funny, the breakfast was bog standard, I could have done better stoned, lol, the rooms were basic but on a budget we got what we paid for, the beds were clean, no mice or rats or other creepy crawlies, we cud smoke in the rooms, No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms which we expected, on a budget come here cos it was well worth it, xxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Small, dated, nice staff but pricey for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the city center and with good food. But the rooms are dated, very small, and not so clean, my bed was junk. The rooms are WAY over priced for what you get. It was what I wanted, small and no frills, but still not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful but eventually tolerable”
Reviews.Author: traxdata2k
Reviews.Content: Arrived and told to wait 3 hours for the room (despite arriving at the correct time). After being told our room was ready we found cigarette butts, sick and a bit of a disaster zone was our room. We complained, we tried to get a refund, we even called the police (who were lovely). Sadly we had to stay but were given the best room (not a great improvement) and a free beer for our troubles. After the initial shock we were happy with it's extremely central location. Would never recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Its worth what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: Trsl
Reviews.Content: Had reservations after reading other reviews but generally ok. It was central and ideal for a place to put your head down for the night. No bugs although room had a damp feel to it but remember you are surrounded by water. The staff were very friendly and accomadating. Room has TV with decent chanels, a working radiator, 24 hour reception and also a free safe in your room which was great for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever use this Hotel abusive staff and disgusting rooms”
Reviews.Author: zoe8102
Reviews.Content: My lovely partner and I arrived for a 5 day stay with Delta Hotel....we left on the first night, what an absolute shambles the staff and place is. The rooms are so bad, TV hanging off the wall, moth holes in curtains, shower broke so many things wrong with this hotel. I asked for an extra blanket as only one sheet on the bed, the guy in reception then proceded to call me a stupid [--] blonde english [--] ranting then aggressively starting showing me how to use the radiator which was behind him and the same as the one in my room. It was uncalled for I was very polite in my asking and hadn't provoked him in any way. I could of complained about the fact that the place is a state looks nothing like the pictures on website and that we had originally asked for a double room and the room we got had two single beds not very romantic but I didn't mention any of that I just wanted a blanket for extra warmth. He kept ranting, raving and at one point during his abuse I felt frightened as he was so aggressive (believe me I am one tough girl but this was scary!). We left and were told we would not get a refund (we paid Â£700) next day we went back to see the manager who told us he would refund the money and was very apologetic (or so we thought) gave him our credit card and he told us he had refunded the whole amount, gave us a slip and when we checked with bank when we got back he had taken the full amount off the card on the day we complained the cheek of it!!!!!!! Unbelieveable I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: renatagh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. The hotel is dirty and disorganized. The breakfast is very poor and the staaf is not polite. I hated to stay there. I don't recomend. Renata

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in the heart of amsterdam, ideal if you're out and about”
Reviews.Author: louisef69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Hotel for two nights. I must admit that we were quite apprehensive of what to expect after reading the reviews on this site. We arrived and the reception desk were accomodating as they allowed us to leave our bags until the official check in time of 2pm. We had to pay a deposit of 50 euros incase we made use of the telephone and the pay per view tv in the room. We went back to the hotel and we were shown our room. I must admit that although it was basic, we were pleasantly surprised by it. Granted the carpet wasn't brand new, but the beds were very clean and so was the bathroom with a hairdryer and use of bath and hand towels. The room had a large window that opened up onto a small concrete square, but we didn't pick this hotel for it's panoramic views. We did sample the breakfast which was a variety of fresh fruit, cereal, yoghurt, cooked bacon, beans and scrambled eggs. There was also tea, coffee, fruit juice and milkshake. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling on a limited budget and would like a hotel within easy access of everything in central amsterdam. The staff were nice and the breakfast was good. Definitely great value, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!”
Reviews.Author: GILLYB007.
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and that's about all. It is dirty and generally unkempt. The bedding was clean but the mattresses were stained. It is noisy because the trams are running all hours but that is not their fault. It is generally unfinished and old. Although the reception staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the feint hearted”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travelmore
Reviews.Content: We are just back home after a one night stay in the Delta Hotel in Amsterdam. I knew when we booked that I was taking a risk with this cheap (given its location) hotel. We were prepared for a very basic set up which was exactly what we got. However, what we hadnt expected was an extremely rude,ignorant and charmless manger . Not only was he rude to us but also to his staff. When I commented on his behaviour he said 'thank you'! Also beware booking through online hotel agencies and not using a credit card. A young italian tried to check in before us and the hotel staff checked the hotel bank account to make sure they had received his money transfer. They had not and he was forced to pay again. The bed linen, towels and the bathroom were clean and there was plenty of hot water. Other than this the place is dirty, smells of damp and is run down. The bathroom door handle came off in my partners hand. If your trip is only for one night and you plan to spend no time in the hotel other than to sleep then you may just be able to survie a trip to the hotel Delta. I would however seriously recommend a trip to a coffee shop to help you feel better about the place before you attempt to sleep there for a night. We certainly wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “A positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: Xetemai
Reviews.Content: Having already made a reservation in Delta, I was a bit worried before going to Amsterdam as these reviews seemed to indicate that me and my girlfriend were going into a dirty and noisy prison infested with bugs. The hotel, however, turned out to be completely different. It didn't look like much from the outside but inside it lived up to its three stars status. All the staff members were friendly and helpful and spoke fluent English. The room we got was small but the sheets and towels were clean (and were kept clean by the staff) and the bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was similar: not very big but all in all, adequate for our purposes. And we didn't see a single bug or cockroach during our visit. And as for location, you really couldn't wish for anything better. Only slight problems we encountered were noises coming from the outside in the night but given the location, they were to be expected. I would recommend this hotel to pretty much anyone, as me and my girlfriend really couldn't find anything to complain about there.

Reviews.Title: “never go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAISYFLOWERWales
Reviews.Content: As above.... I booked this hotel via myamsterdam.com (flight and hotel) the package was very cheap and yes you get what you pay for. Delta Hotel i shared a twin room with my teenage son, the room was crawling, yes i mean crawling with bed bugs... The second night i woke to find a black bug crawling on my arm, i woke put on the light turned over my pillow and there were three more black bugs on closer inspection the sheets and pillows were also full of tiny bed bugs... At 4am i went to speak to the nights porter - complete waste of time as he was unable to help my situation - i asked if i could get a coffee and his reply was "No" so off to my flea crawling room i went, sat up all night with the light on. Spoke to the manager who was very apologetic and would move us to another room... which he did - we slept but was sure glad to be leaving that morning....This hotel should never be rated *** The carpets were so filthy, stained and should be thrown out, windows stinking, wall paper stained (in my room you will notice blood stains) thats where we crushed the bugs. Oh yes the manager said he would find out who was in the room prior to us and where they travelled from - I am now thinking do we need to go for blood tests!! Please DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “To expensive now!!”
Reviews.Author: manorblade
Reviews.Content: I went a few years ago and although its the most basic hotel i have ever stayed in it was ok for what we needed and situtated in a perfect place, Anyway the staff have got to be the rudest and most ignorant i have come across and the young Irish guy that works there was very close to getting a slap for the way he spoke to some of our younger travellers. oh and we were promised 10% off food and drink before we booked only to be told we could not have it once we arrived! Anyway it was cheap and we spent most of the time out so we put up with it! I am returning to Amsterdam again soon and i did a search for hotels and this came up with the prices and i burst out laughing, what a rip off!!! Do not pay the prices they charge it's like roughing it big time. Amsterdam is a great place to Visit but i would stay well clear of this dirty dump!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “it no that bad”
Reviews.Author: arf_c
Reviews.Content: our room was clean and tidy so was shower room staff where very helpfull and the Location of the hotel is perfect for coffee shops would use this hotel Again

Reviews.Title: “horrendous”
Reviews.Author: barbaracheshunt
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in hotels all over the world but Ive never stayed in anywhere that is so filthy as the Delta.The xcarpets are so dirty that you couldn`t possibly walk on them without shoes on.The rooms are thick with dust and filth.The only good thing about the place is that its in a very central position. It anoys me looking at all the reviews that the Delta obviously don`t care about the state of the place as they havn`t done anything to put things right..They really should read the reviews on their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Tip!!”
Reviews.Author: sana-b33
Reviews.Content: Oh my god! My fiance and i have just came back from Amsterdam and stayed at the Delta. We booked this as it was supposed to be a 3 star and near all the attractions. I wouldnt even give this hotel a 1* its a tip! It needs a complete overhall, its dirty, old and the staff are not polite, and the lift is temperamental, and covered in graffiti which they tried to disguise with a price list for the resturant thats attached, where we ate our breakfast, thats if there was any left, they didnt refill any of the breakfast, and if you ask for a mug for your coffee or tea. my god they have a fit! All the hotel has got going for it is the location. Even saying that id rather catch a tram to the nearest attraction than stay at this hotel again. I dont know how that hotel has not been closed down..and they even asked for a 50 euro deposit when we arrived and they asked jokingly when we checked out if we had broken anything,,haha not amused as theres nothing to break or take....Amsterdam itself has loads to see but very expensive. Make sure you take plenty of euros and got your walking shoes on.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: eurotravellerIreland
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a dump. Rooms are horrible, I awoke during the night to a cockroach in my bed!! Rooms are like something from hundreds of years ago and the elevator in this place is an absolute joke. I would not recommend a dog to even stay here. I don't know why this place hasn't been closed down by health and safety.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel definitley not worth staying in!”
Reviews.Author: antog09
Reviews.Content: the pictures on the hotel website certainly dont match what you get! we were situated on the 5th floor, room size a large singleroom, wardobe door catches in double bed on opening, you dont get a doulble sheet to cover you, you get 2 singles, also what they dont tell you is that on top floor is the heating system which comez on every morning at 6am and vibrates your room! also what kind of hotel has an iron but ironing board, whe asked what should i use, i was told maybe your bed! location wise is good, but this place needs to SERIOUSLY revamp its facilities, ie bedrooms toliets,but never in million years would i return to this "hotel" if your like cheap and not so cheerful, this is for your but if you require a good nights sleep then dont, they also dont mention that they are very near a church whose bells go off every 30 mins from about 6am to 12pm! it well worth to spend an extra few euro to find an actual decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “shabby!! no way a 3*!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueraven1
Reviews.Content: I`d been to Amsterdam before and we`d met a few people who were staying here so we thought it looked like a good location.It was.Central to everything and only a few minutes walk to central station. However,hotel was shabby.It should be a hostel.Carpets filthy,sheets filthy.In fact we slept on top of the covers.We were given a large spacious room that slept 5 and as there was only 3 of us in the room then there was lots of room.A couple who were with us weren`t so lucky.They were put in,what could only be decribed as a cell..complete with bars on the windows and a view of a brick wall. Bathroom was mouldy and smelt bad.Towels weren`t fresh and no one would replace them,so went and bought my own. Staff were exteremely unhelpful and I think they pretended they didn`t understand what we were asking.We weren`t rude or anything. On the second night there was a group of men fighting out in the corridor,which went on all night.They were punching each other and kept banging on our door for us to let them in.They were cursing at us through the door.Very frightening so some security would be good!! Breakfast was ok,but only if you can`t wait to get elsewhere for some.If you are thinking of staying here,think again.I highly recommend an Apartment instead.We done this the first time and if there is a group of you then its a cleaner,more comfortable and cheaper choice.

Reviews.Title: “hogmanay 2008 crawling with beasts”
Reviews.Author: marlynInverness
Reviews.Content: arrived tues 29th dec 08 .waited 1 hour to be seen to. room was shabby filthy and woke to red beasts about finger nail length in our beds .window wouldnt shut .basic bed and tv that was it. went to reception and was told we had brought beasts with us from scotland and lAUGHED AT US.she said she phoned manager who finally turned up hour half later.at this time we had phoned home to inverness and my mother had arranged us to stay at holiday inn which was a fraction of the price and ten times better!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you're looking for a retro 1970's Eastern block experience!”
Reviews.Author: tampopotwo
Reviews.Content: Very worn out and tatty. Noisy at the front as the windows were poor and didn't shut properly. Breakfast included but poor (didn't think you could get coffee that bad outside the UK). Don't leave it too late to have a shower in the morning as the hot water runs out. We've stayed in Amsterdam several times before and know you won't get luxury unless you pay a small fortune, but all in all the Delta is about what you'd expect for half the price. The only good thing about it is it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Adah
Reviews.Content: 3* no way..... It is the most disgusting place i have ever stayed in and i couldnt wait for the two nights to be over. The hotel is a tiny dingy place and after seeing the room we were allocated i just wanted to run out of the place but knew we wouldnt find any place else at such short notice. The windows were all broken and the wood rotten. The bed just about fit in the room and no space at all around it. you would have to climb in to it from the bottom. Needless to say there were no bedside lockers. The room was so dark. The carpet was so filthy and the sheets on the bed stained. I couldnt figure out how they could justify selling this room at all. Revolting.The bathroom although tiny was relatively clean. Of course i went to reception and told them i couldnt possibly stay in such a room and the receptionist gave me keys of two other rooms to look at. They were just a fraction better so we choose one. The beds in that place should all be burnt. If the carpet was clean i would probably have slept on the floor they were so uncomfortable. One evening while we were waiting in reception for friends another guest came down waving a rubber mask and demanding to know how it got in his shower. He was furious and said it wasnt there when he left his room in the morning. Weird or what but he wasnt one bit impressed. The only thing you could eat at breakfast was the toast. The scrambled eggs were like rubber and the bacon was swimming in a couple inches of fat. The fruit was tinned with the exception of a basket of oranges and you were lucky to find a cup for your coffee. I was ever so glad to get out of the place. A vending machine in the hotel lobby offered snacks at â‚¬2.50 each for twix, kitkat, etc. RIP OFF. I must say the reception staff were nice and it did appear that many things were way out of their control. Management on the other hand should be held accountable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Delta Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Leslie20
Reviews.Content: My self and a friend booked into the Delta Hotel in Amsterdam for a three day break in August 2008, it was the cheapest of all the hotels we had looked at on the net and we dicided to take a chance and book same. We were pleasently surprised, the rooms were big and comfortable and very clean, which was great, due to the weather, which was quite cool and wet for the duration of our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful and very pleasant, which encouraged the other guests to be friendly and share their adventures at breakfast. Breakfast was a buffet try the eggs and bacon they were just what a tourist needed to start the day. This hotel is not the Ritz however its central location, the friendly service, the excellent breakfast and the light airy room has made me write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Three strikes - not stars - you're out!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flyer_2008
Reviews.Content: The pictures and the reality could not be more different... I will compain to the local hotels association in Amsterdam. When I arrived I was perplexed by the rather gloomy reception. When I entered the room I was shocked - for GB Pounds 95.00 and 3 stars I was expecting something akin to what I can expect in London... for 3 stars and less. This "hotel" should be immediately downgraded to a "hostel" and actual photos reflect the spartan and amateurishly cleaned room. I stayed in 366 - a single room facing what can only be described as an ashtray, where even the malfuntioning TV reflected this Adams Family horror story masquerading as a venue fit for human habitation. Do not stay here, no matter how desperate... I refer you to the following link for more of the same... [--]

Reviews.Title: “Average 2* NOT Higher!”
Reviews.Author: OnwardTraveller
Reviews.Content: Expedia sold this dump as a *** Hotel - no chance! Our room - booked as double - just about had enough space to fit in a double bed. No walking round the edges, so you had to climb on the bed to get into it. No bedside light, so to turn the light off you had to get off the bed to walk across the room, down a step, round a corner to the light switch and then retrace your steps in the dark. The window directly overlooked another room, which I realised when getting undressed as the bed was directly under the window. Result: curtains closed throughout. One light didn't work and had to be replaced. TV collapsed and had to be replaced. Carpet worn. On the plus side (everyone has to be positive!) the staff were friendly and the breakfast was fine. Advice: go if you get a ** price, but not otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't as bad as everyone was making out!”
Reviews.Author: k_fairy84
Reviews.Content: Just to give you an idea of what type of person I am, well I'm totally honest person and if I don't like something I will say so...so everything I put here is totally true and upfront. I was travelling to the Dam on Sat 12th July 08 which I booked six weeks earlier direct. I wasn't too impressed when I read the reviews for the hotel but with no time left, there was nothing that I could do but have a look for myself. After finding the hotel in a matter of minutes from the train station, we were greeted with the hotel covered in scaffolding. I suppose that all places have to have mainintance done at sometime! We all went into reception and was greeted by a nice guy behind the desk. As we got there at 11am, we had to wait until 2pm to check in. We were told that we could leave our bags in the lobby.
