Can't say that I was overly impressed with this as my life was in my case!!! But as I had the heaviest bag out of the group I knew it wouldn't go far!! So we left them. We went for a look around town and came back at 2pm. We got all checked in which went fine and got our keys. Seven of us were stopping at the hotel in three different rooms, so I suppose that I had more of a look in other rooms than most of the other people who have been to stay. Me and my partner were in a room on the first floor, the other double on the second floor and the triple on the forth floor. Some other review had mentioned that there were no rails on the stair wells.... well how do you paint them without someone getting varnish on their clothes and complaining?!! You take them off!! All of them were there apart from two. Anyway there was a lift if it bothered anyone that much!! The room was quite nice. It was right down the bottom of the coridor next to the fire exit. The bedroom bit was fine, the view wasn't all that good but you'd expect that as the building are all close together. But your in AMSTERDAM! Your not going to be looking out of your window all the time, if at all. The bathroom was clean with fresh towels. The only problem with the bathroom was the smell from the drains. We had a wardrobe behind the door which did hum abit. As we were only staying for 2 nights, there wasn't much point of unpacking. The room on the second floor was ok too. It was a different layout but all the same it was ok for the weekend. The room on the forth floor was a good size for three people. The only major problem that any of us had was that the screw had come out of one of the room door handles (on the inside). A guy eventually came up but spent more time on the phone than actually fixing the door. I wouldn't have minded but all it needed was a longer screw!!! All the beds that I sat/slept on were comfortable unless you have a Â£1000 mattress back at home! The shower was fine, hot and had a good flow of water. None of this water dripping out of the shower head like I have had back in the UK a number of times! We didn't get around to eating breakfast as we were out all of the Sat night and came back around 9 on Sunday morning. We did however have some food in the restaurant on Sunday night. The steak was really nice. Cooked just right and very lean. Again not something you get that often in the UK. The service etc was great. The only things that bothered me was a slight smell throughout the hotel but its an old place + there are no windows in the coridors + landings and how hot some of the rooms got. My room on floor one was fine but the room on the forth floor got very hot. I would go back to the Delta Hotel again. Maybe the rooms/hotel might be finished when I go back. Just hope that the prices dont go up!! Just dont expect the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Dump!”
Reviews.Author: SnapperMike
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel via EasyJet Hotels - don't they ever check out what they recommend?! I shared a room with my father in law - 4th to 6th July 2008. The single beds we had were small and both beds were up against opposite walls with a gap of 14 inches in between - gives you an idea of how small the room was. The carpet and walls, ceilings paintwork was ancient and filthy - only the bathroom was relatively clean. The furniture appeared to have been purchased from Oxfam - several years ago! Bannister rails were missing from staircase walls. Breakfast was included in the price - but there was hardly any choice - fruit, bread, cereal, salami, boiled eggs, scambled egg and very fatty bacon - plan for breakfast elsewhere! Basically, if you're considering it - book elsewhere. If you've booked it - unlucky (as we were)!

Reviews.Title: “absolute disgrace, should be shut down”
Reviews.Author: kissrocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and can honestly say without doubt that this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and that's saying something. Reception clerk was rude, demanding and completely insincere. Hotel staff were non-existent. The room itself was on the 1st floor with barred windows overlooking a ledge with all sorts of age old muck and grime, including a long dead bird. The bed was ancient, lumpy and totally uncomfortable and looked distinctly unclean. The wife wore more clothes to bed than when outside. The carpets were disgusting and horribly stained all over. All in all I would seriously recommend the closure of this place and a total rebuild carried out. Avoid like the Plague for youe own health.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: backonearth
Reviews.Content: very simple, clean, the staff was great very nice. central to everthing. we will stay here again when (not if) we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: grayskies2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 3 nights and would happily recommend this hotel to budget-conscious travellers. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the Damrak and although it was noisy with the windows open it didn't bother us too much. The room was a good size and although the furniture was a bit tatty the beds were clean and comfortable. The shower worked well and the water was hot. The breakfast was more than adequate, choice of cereals, scrambled eggs, bacon and beans, only complaint we had was with the toaster, which took around 5 minutes to toast 2 slices of bread, resulting in a queue which blocked the whole of the breakfast area. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we took the train from the airport to Central Station. We found the hotel very easily from the directions given on our booking confirmation, it was about 10 minutes walk from the station. We found the prices of everything very high due to the poor Â£/â‚¬ exchange, so considered this hotel to be good value for money for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Schipholio
Reviews.Content: It's been a few years... but I'll sum it up: When I first came in from Damrak, I noticed the lobby was bit funky smelling. When I checked in, I got hit with a 70e deposit (which was later given back at check out). It was a bit dim and somebody was passed out in the middle of the lobby. The room apppeared to be clean. I opened the curtains and my view was a brick wall and some trash strewn around the ground. The WC was decent and clean and there were towels. Very basic. I went out after a shower for some beers and food. When I came back later that night I was scolded by the front desk personel for not leaving my key with them. The ventilation in my room was quite poor and I couldn't sleep that well... i just sweated in bed all night... Check out was a easy enough...except having to make my way around about 50 dudes and their baggage through the tiny and stuffy lobby. Not exactly a honeymoon resort. The people hanging around the area just outside after 10pm are up to no good... go there with your buddy or alone for a quick stay and get the hell out. Central Station is very close...

Reviews.Title: “loved the lcoation”
Reviews.Author: moli25
Reviews.Content: We had a great time mostly due to the fantastic location of the hotel, very central minutes from the red light district and tram stops just across the road. The hotel was very clean, the beds were comfy and the water for the shower was hot. The rooms we had were spacious. The staff on reception were very helpful, they recommended a restaurant Gouco's this is a great place to eat and is about 3 mins from the hotel, just ask reception for directions. The breakfast was good, hot and plenty of it. The location of the hotel is the biggest draw to this hotel, we went as a family with an age range of 19 - 70 so the location was brilliant within 1 minute we had shops, coffee shops, restaurants and bars. We would definately return to this hotel again. If your lucky enough to get a room at the front the view is great. You can sit and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised at how great it was!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sleepwhenurdead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta Hotel on the Damrak, number 42 (the main strip) from 19th March'08 till 21st March for my hen do. Not much to look at from the outside but inside it was like a 5* hotel! Cost: 6 of us shared an 8 bed room for 2 nights at Â£42 per person, including breakfast both mornings. Location: Our room faced the canal and main Damrak strip, the front of the hotel. 10mins walk from Dam Square and not much further away from the nightlife of the bars and nightclub 'Escape'. Perfect location. canal boat rides were opposite us and we were central to all the shops and coffee shops. Food: The food was excellent and the staff were brilliant in the hotel resturant downstairs. As a guest you get 10% off meals and drinks too- remember to show your room key!! Drinks are allowed to be taken upstairs. Resturant was very clean, you can watch them cook as the kitchen is open. Its also open to passers by for food so its not just guests eating there but we had no trouble with finding a table and they are very accomodating for larger parties (moving tables around etc) Breakfast was included in price. Bacon, eggs, beans, toast, yogurt, fruit, cereal, tea, coffee etc. Lunch served until 4pm, baquettes etc. Dinner, open till 11pm, was excellent. 9.25 euros for spagetti bolognase for example, huge serving too! 6 euros for large bottle of water, 3 for hot chocolate with cream - delicious! Rooms: VERY comfortable, huge pillows, proper quilts, white linen, no itchy blankets! Good towels, replenished if needed. Very clean. Double doors open onto balcony, can lean out but not big enough to stand on. Smoking was allowed in rooms. Bathroom was big, open shower/wet room. 6 mirrors in room, TV with music channels and english subtitles (not that you would want to stay in much, but good for a lazy morning!!) Desk, wardrobe, bedside tables, sofa and table and safe box in room. Excellent room , would highly reccomend. be warned thou....if you are not a smoker you may not appreciate the stale smell of smoke in the room! But the double balcony doors are a blessing, and if youre going to smoke in the room anyway it doesnt matter! our room was cleaned, there made our beds and tidied towels etc but left all our clutter where it was which was great! Didnt have to tidy things away before going out.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barnieboy
Reviews.Content: This is never a three star hotel. The location is fantastic but the hotel is horrible. The rooms are shoddy the carpet is threadbare it was more like a youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: bluejinty
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam.We stopped at the Delta with 3 x other couples, 2 of the couples were being bit by bed bugs. The breakfast was disgusting, everyhting was cold and had been sitting there from early morning until 10-00am. The rooms were dark and dismal even though they say it has been refurbished recently. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the only good point about the hotel was the shower was good. Do not stop here.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bed bugs! Budget should not mean dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Covgooner
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in Amsterdam so I have something to compare with. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. The website says the hotel has been renovated but as the staff advised only the bathrooms have been done. The rooms are tiny, what I expected. The mattress is about 30 years old. I wanted to use the spare pillows in the room but when I saw them I would not let my dog sleep on them. I did not dare check under the pillowcases! We were a party of 4 couples in 4 rooms. Two of us were bitten all over the body by something. I challenged the reception staff and they said that they had tested for bugs 2 weeks before and were told they were clean. Coincedence, I think not. I accept that you get what you pay for, 218 euro for 2 nights but I think you will do better without any problem. While the breakfast is free, it is of little value if you cannot eat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MancReviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a friends birthday and all we wanted was a bed for the night in a good location and that is all it is. It was not perticularly cheap 230 Euros for 2 nights in a single room I think is steep for what it is. The single room I was in was tiny and I mean tiny, it was cleanish but could do with a refurb. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was just about edible! Would I stay here again, NO!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: mjjjm5
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue (stayed at the Delta in summer 2003). This was hands down the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The only positive I can think of is it's location, close to Centraal Station. The staff was uncaring, our room was not ready when promised, the room was depressingly dark and run-down. The bathroom was in desperate need of attention (loose fixtures, chipped tiles). The room's closet/wardrobe was dangerously close to falling apart. The door lock didn't work properly and we felt unsafe the entire night we stayed there. I would not rate the Delta Hotel even a one out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: RobSqu
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews of the Delta we were pleasantly surprised. We had a room for 9. Which was 9 single beds in a dorm style. We had one bathroom which contained a toilet and 2 showers and a sink. The bathroom was clean and hot water was available all day and it was very hot. We took our own towels following reviews on tripadvisor but we could have used the hotel towels as they were fine. The Hotel is about a five minute walk from the main amsterdam station - it is five minutes from the grasshopper. In reality It is 5 minutes from everything as it is centrally located. The hotel was very cheap at about 25 pounds per person per night. It was clean. Staff were helpful. Dont know what breakfast was like we never made it. Ideal hotel for young people sampling the culture.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God!!!!”
Reviews.Author: danreeves
Reviews.Content: Me and four friends recently went for a weekend in the dam.We booked the Delta through a amsterdam based company.Upon arriving to the front desk at around 12 midday we were made to wait 20mins by the rude staff who totally ignored us.The 5 person "room" was more a loike a one man gas chamber!!!The room had an awful scent of what i can only describe as urine.Oh and more before we were given the key to our room we had to pay 26.50E each for T.V remote!! We complained 2days in a row to which there was no response. Day 2 was'nt much better either ..when by friend came back to the room saying he had just seen around 3-4 mice in a little doorway on the stairs.I couldnt believe it until i seen the state of the resurant that morning for breakfast. Stay away from this place unless you like flea bites

Reviews.Title: “Double Duvet Scandal!”
Reviews.Author: n0rrie
Reviews.Content: Wish the reviews on Easy to Book had been as honest as we may have reconsidered staying at this hotel. The location is undisputedly ideal but the hotel description could start with "Don't get your hopes up!" followed by "Shabby and scabby". We were stuck in an attic room (ironically referred to as the penthouse by receptionist) which was dingy, musky, no tea coffee facilities, a shower with no shower curtain and the water flooded the toilet. Sink in the bedroom rather than the toilet. Stains on carpets,walls, light fittings. Manky window that didn't close. Curtain that didn't cover the window. Having booked a double room we stupidly expected a double bed with double sheets etc. (how naive) We found two single sheets, two single duvets and cushions disguised as pillows on a double bed! When we had the impertinence to ask for a double duvet and sheets the receptionist said "We don't have many." At 364 Euros for 3 nights we didn't think that a double duvet came only for business class. On the up side - the whole scenario provided much hilarity after we'd visited the local coffee shops! ( Laughter quickly disappeared on returning home and finding insect bites on my shoulder ) Easy to book should take responsibility for advertising this place as a three star establishment. This "hotel" could easily be mistaken for a hostel but should reflect this in their prices.

Reviews.Title: “After poor reviews there seems to be little attempt to raise the standards.”
Reviews.Author: LondonPippo
Reviews.Content: Staying for two nights over a weekend was just bearable the cost to quality ratio didnâ€™t seem fair, To say it is a three star accommodation is an insult to those hoteliers who try hard to gain there stars. I stayed on the ground floor, with very poor security and zero hotel lobby facilities; it seemed like a hostel rather than hotel. The lobby was used as a store for spare seats from the restaurant, one of the two highly priced vending machines was turned off on a trolley and the shoe cleaner was out of order. The room lights were very dim, with unsafe looking television stands, lumpy pillows, no instructions for the safe and a shower that didnâ€™t let the water run down. The final insult was the breakfast, The toaster hadnâ€™t been plugged into the wall, and on the same day the coffee urn was just full of warm water. The food selection was basic if not in bulk. Iâ€™ve never gone to Amsterdam expecting quality but if your on business and need a place to relax after a days work, look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Twiggy67
Reviews.Content: Our party of 9 ranged from 15 to 70 years old, we had previously read reviews of this hotel and wondered why we had booked. Apart from a mix up with the booking which meant one of our party had to stay on her own in a single room everything was ok. We checked the mattresses immediately but found them to be quite new, the bed linen was crisp and white, the bathroom and towels were very clean. The carpet on the walls that was mentioned in a review was supposed to be a 'feature' and not hiding anything. The breakfast was plentiful and the restaurant that was open to the public was always full. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the only downfall was the stained carpets but then if you kept your shoes on or took slippers that was bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap As Chips”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterLad84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Delta - paid around Â£60 and thought the hotel was more than worth the low price we paid. Rooms are very basic but was clean and tidy with safety deposit box in room. Hotel is ideally located right in the heart of Amsterdam 1 minute walk from Dam Square, with easy access to trams to get anywhere in the city such as Vondelpark or the Museum Square. The price also includes daily breakfast which is available until 10:30am on an all you can eat basis! I'd go for the continental breakfast option (Croissants, Juice etc) rather than the English breakfast as this was not that nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff great, position couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl046
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasntly surprised by our stay at this hotel after reading some of the reviews. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make us welcome. Had a lovely room on the fourth floor overlooking street and canal. The noise from traffic was not a bother even with the window open. Breakfast was good choices and as much as you wanted. The bathrooms have been newly renovated and the room clean. Make sure you take a trip on the canals the best way of getting around. Would definitely go back there again and recomment it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “The Dirty Delta !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: belfasttouristttt
Reviews.Content: Do not ever consider staying at this dump.this is without question the worst hotel in the world.not fit for human habitation.its a disgrace that its still allowed to rip off tourists.when my wife complained about the condition of the room i.e.used condoms etc.the manager became very aggressive and when we cancelled our stay they refused to return the full monies they had deducted from our credit card.this is without doubt the worst hotel in amsterdam.it shoulsd be closed down immediatly as a health risk.take my advice dont even consider staying at this kip. I even complained to the dutch tourist office about this place. Tourist Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend, You Pay For What You Get, A Bargain!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rabecca
Reviews.Content: FOR GOODNESS SAKE!!!!!!!!!!, why are people moaning about this hotel, yes its certainly not up to scratch, but did you not read the reviews before you went, Â£30 per night, you pay for what you get. if you wanted something classy or nicer then, go to the other hotels, because there are some nice ones in amsterdam square. Yes admitally i would not of picked the hotel and did moan a bit about it, but why let it ruin your trip, your only there a short while. People moaning its loud etc..... well why go to amsterdam and stay in a hotel where it clearly states it is in the town center. There are 2 things that will credit this hotel for cert and that is its LOCATION AAAAAAAAAAAAAA********* AND THE RECEPTION MEN, god they could not of been any more helpful,they are very polite and nothing is too much trouble. Anyway there were 11 of us ranging from 19 - 50+ on a hen weekend. We had a fantastic time. If you want late night drinking, would definatly recommend the GRASSHOPPER, its near our hotel and such fantastic music, good dancy tracks. on a sunday pubs tend to close around mid night, so go to bottle bank which is a ten second walk from hotel that is open til 3. the reception staff will point you in right direction. Went to a night club called Escape, one of the best night clubs in europe. really good music. had fantasic time. Went on a boat canal ride, really good to see sites, some of the girls (ladies) went on the windmill trip and see where cheese is made. Oh so funny, went to a sex muesum -MUST GO. really good, good to see how things were back in the 1820 - saucy buggers. go down the stairs where you go in a room - it does state entre at your own risk and no complaints. One thing i did hate, and got on my nerves was paying to use the toliet. that applied everywhere, restuarants, burger king toilets, bars. make sure you have 50 cent on you.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisatreanor1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the reception was lovely and clean but when we went around the corner to go up the stairs the smell started the place was filthy dirty I dont think the place has ever seen a hoover since it opened and the walls in the hall were rotten with dirt and blood all I could think I sope the room is not like this. I opened the room door and there was just enough room for the bed it was tiny and the carpet on the floor and yes the walls was rotten. The shower was tiny good job im a small person. Overall I did not enjoy my stay there at all. A bit of advice take your slippers or something if you want to walk from the bed to the shower oh and a pair of earplugs the noise at night is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “gobsmacked”
Reviews.Author: topcat067
Reviews.Content: Well how disappointed were we on opening the door to our room. The room looked nothing like the rooms advertised on the website. In fact we were given a tiny attic room, (Anne Franks room was larger!) The room had a small wardrobe that was broken. The lights by the bed didn't work. The towels had holes in them. The bathroom or washroom was moldy and the shower didn't work properly. One minute the water was running cold and the next you got scalded by boiling water. There was a gaping hole in the wall for ventilation through which I could see daylight. We left the hotel one morning to fly home having found that there was absolutely no hot or cold water in our room. We were told it would be a few minutes! After breakfast we returned to our room approximately an hour after speaking to reception about the water and there was still no water, we couldn't even brush our teeth or have a wash! We feel that we were misled by the photographs on the web site and the wording. Paying in advance which is also wrong as once you have paid there was no way of getting your money back or changing hotel. The rate was extortionate considering the condition of the room we were given. The only thing the Hotel had going for it was the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “No Eating!!”
Reviews.Author: Soomany
Reviews.Content: We got there and I was a bit surprised when they chrged our entire stay the moment we checked in. This way if you want to leave, you can't because you've already paid for your stay. The rooms were small and the bathroom primative. The worst part is when we got back to the hotel late with food and the "door man" told us we had to eat in the lobby because they don't allow food in the rooms because the cleaning crew did not want to clean uo the mess. NO FOOD IN THE ROOMS, IT'S AMSTERDAM!! I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stays”
Reviews.Author: warwick43
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel is situated in a great location, right in the heart of Amterdam. It is literally a 5 minute walk to Cenral Station, and another 5 minutes in the opposite direction to Dam Square. From the outside the Delta Hotel doesnt look to be much, but inside is a lot better. The reception area is neat and tidy, and the recpetion staff were extremely friendly. They were willing to help us with directions to various places, and gave us a free map. There is a restaurant next to the hotel, which is where the breakfast is served. This is an excellent buffet style breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, toast, fruit, cereal, tea, coffee, cheese and juice. There is a discount off main meals and drinks for guests of the hotel. We spent 1 night in the hotel and booked a 6 bed room, and a twin room for me and my friends. The twin room was clean, neat and tidy with a modern bathroom and television. The 6 bed room was very large, with double doors onto a small balcony overlooking the main street. We had 4 beds, and 2 pull down sofa beds, which, for what we paid, was expected. The bathroom was very large and modern, with a bath, shower, WC and 2 sinks. The only complaint was that there wasnt a shower curtain, and there was a rather large window in the door to the bathroom. Those who were bashful had to block the window using a towel. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel isnt the neatest, or tidyest place we could have stayed but for the money we paid it was excellent value for money. We would definately recommend it, perhaps not for those wishing to have a long getaway, but definately for those who, like ourselves, were only looking for a place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “DNA all over sheets, towels and walls”
Reviews.Author: thry
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a joke at first. we walked into a room with a bare mattress which had yellow stains all over it. The bath towels were all ripped with red stains on them. The cups by the sink had crusted white residue all over them. When we complained, they basically laughed at us. They would not let us cancel our other two nights, so we ended up having to stay in this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, easy access, my stay was okay”
Reviews.Author: MissK10
Reviews.Content: Okay if you want a luxury hotel, where you want to stay in your room for the whole holiday this place aint for you, but somewhere to sleep is fine. Centrally located, easily found from the station. The receptionist was very friendly, we had breakfast once so I couldn't give you much a review, the one time I went it was okay, nothing special but if your hungry then it will set you up for the day. The the double room was pretty small but had everything, nice new bathroom, TV and safe, the only thing that put me off the room was the carpets, they were a worse for wear and stained in places which worried me a little, I ended up putting towels all over the place, they were replaced every day and the bed was made also. We stayed at the back which was quiet so perhaps if we had been at the front it might have been noiser but what do you expect in the middle of the city. Its okay, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've stayed in the whole year!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: randygit
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the Hotel, I realised I'd been given a two single bed room which was adequate at best. I'm not that fussy generally, but the place cost me about Â£125 a night. Was shabby, in need of repair and basic. When I went to sleep that night on a rock hard mattress and was bitten by Fleas or whatever was in the bed. The next morning I had no sleep, had massive lumps and bite marks all over my back (even my forehead) When I complained that night they didn't seem to care and I asked for another room. No better, but minus the fleas. I travel all over the world every week and have never stayed in a hotel this poor especially for the asking price. Oh and the only hotel I have ever stayed in that couldn't even supply me with an iron. I know I'm a business traveller, but as long as a place is clean I'm happy. Absolute DUMP. Tell people you don't like to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Batho1989
Reviews.Content: Six Ladies aged 18 - 40ish went for a 40th Birthday. Having read the reviews after booking we expected the worst. The hotel is 5mins from station, main shopping area and bars. GREAT LOCATION. We found the rooms to be clean and tidy with towels changed every day. Breakfast was ok but the staff don't smile. The only downside was that because of its location it is very noisy all night. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location then stop here. We would go again and there are some fussy women in our party.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: dan90120
Reviews.Content: I have to say that if you are looking for an enjoyable stay in Amsterdam you would do well to steer well away form this hotel ( i use the term hotel very loosley). The bathrooms were terrible and the rooms were so much worse. Clean towels? Fresh bedsheets? these are just few of the things you will NOT find here.The only point worth mentioning is its location...it is ideally located near centraal station and other local amenities.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute disgrace never again.”
Reviews.Author: mich007
Reviews.Content: We as a college group stayed in this hotel. There was 8 girls in a room and now imagine 8 girls in a room all getting ready at the one time to go out. To our suprise there was only 1 shower which i thought was a disgrace and to make matters worse you wouldnt call it a shower, i had to stand on my tip toes and lay against the wall to get nearer the shower and the water that was coming out of it would barely wash your face it was a disgrace. There was no bath. Our friends had baths. The hotel staff are very noisy and creepy. The Breakfast in the restuarant if you would call it that was not great. The only good thing about this hotel is its near everything such as the train station, trams and the red light. If i was to go back to amsterdam i would find a better hotel as this hotel was in my opinion a disgrace. It looked more like a hostel to me....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for stag Party”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June for my stag do and found the hotel better than expected after reading the reviews on this site. The hotel isn't the best I have stayed in but it was ideal for what we used it for.(sleeping,shower,getting dressed). Rooms are clean and it is in an idea llocation. 5 mins from train station and 5 mins from all bars and coffee shops. We had a great time and no problems with hotel what so ever.we was even allowed to leave our bags at the reception at 9.00am even though we couldn't check in till 1.pm. Hotel was a little more expensive than others but I didn't mind as it was in a good locaton!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but thats about it....”
Reviews.Author: CPalmer33
Reviews.Content: After booking what I thought was a pretty good deal, I was horrified to see the latest reviews talking about fleas in the beds. I'd booked our trip as a surprise for my boyfriends 30th birthday and was getting really worried about our stay, anyway.... the staff were really friendly, the sheets and towels were clean, although they weren't changed while we were there I didn't think this was a problem for 3 nights. The view was awful (a brick wall) but the location more than made up for it, across the road from the 'coffee shops', the red light district and the main station we couldn't have asked for a better location. We only managed to get up for breakfast once, and we realised we hadn't missed much, OK if you like toast but don't bother with the English breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to people that aren't expecting to spend too much time in their hotel room, but do try to get a cheap deal as I felt it was over priced!

Reviews.Title: “Book if it's a last resort..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pro's :-Good Location :-Quiet Rooms :-Staff Reasonably Friendly :-Beds Confortable Cons:-Rooms Very Small :-Hotel Fairly Run Down & Needs Renovation :-No Fridge :-No food allowed in rooms (considering a very poor hotel- resturant this is a joke) :-Rooms Not Cleaned/Vacumed Daily..change of sheets and towels only :-Views of Industrial sites :-Reception Vending Machine-can of still water- 2.50 Euros! :-Request of extra 40 euros on arrival for tv deposit (tv was literally from the 1970's) Ive stayed in much nicer hostels and cheaper/better hotels. Whoever runs this place must be raking in the cash..book only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LynMumford
Reviews.Content: Don't book this hotel by what you see on the website as the pictures are very misleading. I hope you don't get Room 006 unless you like views of walls - there was a brick wall in the room and a brick wall 3 feet outside the window (in front and on both sides of the window). It was so dark that we had to have the light on whatever time of day it was. There were a pair of men's underpants outside the window and also a pair of jeans - both had been there some time. I did inform reception but not sure that anything will be done about it. We were also charged about an extra 40 Euros tax when we arrived on top of the price we were quoted - this came as a surprise to us. It is in no way a 3* hotel and I don't consider that 320+ Euros for 3 nights is cheap. The breakfast was poor and the staff were very slow replenishing dishes and cutlery. I was told one morning that I would have to wait 10 minutes for a cereal bowl as that's how long the machine takes to wash them!! The only plus is that the hotel is ideally situated for most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “don't know what to say!!!”
Reviews.Author: evolutionchaz
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights at the end of may. location great, right outside everything- straight across the road from red light district etc!!! breakfast not so good, but for the price, can't really complain. did like the fact that when we checked out early, we could leave our luggage at no cost.- what i didn't like were the fleas that shared our bed!!- out of 4 people staying there, in 2 different rooms, all 4 of us had the great pleasure of returning with souvenirs of blisters that itched like mad. personally i received 5!!! to ask if i would stay there again??- don't think so- don't have that sort of thing back home- so why would i go somewhere that gives them when i have to pay for the privilidge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Food, yuck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I fortunately was not staying at this hotel but called there for the 'full English breakfast'. It took 35 minutes to arrive, waitress was OK, problem was the kitchen staff. The breakfast was not up to scratch either!! Very poor performance.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this”
Reviews.Author: Gardentraveler52
Reviews.Content: Not as expected. Booked on Easy to Book as 3-star hotel. Surely not. Dirty entrance and lift. Lift works but slow. Men hanging around reception most of day. Quiet room, amazing on this busy street. Room v small, carpet stained, grout in bathroom dirty, ceiling leaked and stained and lumpy like something is growing under it, furniture badly chipped. Sink by the bed, toilet and shower through separate door, smelly, no real ventilation. The food was passable, tinned fruit, eggs but there were cats in the kitchen. Main problem was someone opened my door in the night. I left at 5.30 the next morning. The receptionist was rude and unhelpful and said she was going to charge for two nights because I was cancelling. It was not a cancellation, I moved because I felt unsafe. The person in charge only comes in on Tues. My advice, avoid this, I paid 100 E a night and it is definitey not worth it and in my opinion not safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a married couple both in our sixties and have travelled quite a bit, usually staying in moderately cheap places as this gives us scope to see more. We wanted a place centrally located because of mobility problems. Hotel Delta seemed to suit our needs so we booked a room for 3 nights. However when we read some of the reviews we had serious doubts. As it was for such a short time we thought we'd go anyway. On our arrival the receptionists were very polite & helpful, & spoke perfect English. The lift worked(thank goodness as we were on the 4th floor) & our room we found to be clean & adequate if basic. As we had found a very good deal with Easy to Book on line we decided the place was ideal. There was a brick wall as a view from the window but that didn't matter as we were out all day anyway. There is still some building equipment outside the lift for ongoing refurbishment but it wasn't in the way. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with a good selection served in the restaurant at street level. The food was so good we went back for lunch! What do these people who criticise want ? If they want excellence they should pay more. The only downside for us was we had some noisy inconsiderate young lads on our floor who shouted and slammed doors from about midnight till 3 am. That was not the fault of the hotel. We thought the hotel gave good value, good service and is ideally situated. We shall use it again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place, don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Sujaa
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in!! We have travelled all over the USA, most of Western Europe, all over the East coast of Australia, many places in India, and a few countries of Asia, from 5* to caravan parks, this still makes the 'grade' as one of the worst in terms of price-value proposition (paid on average with tax Eu125 per day for a triple, that's more than what I paid in Paris for a place near the Louvre!!). My observations: (1) Our triple room was furnished (or rather unfurnished) in the most basic manner (3 single beds, a TV, a table & chair, 2 side tables in a bare walled room) (2) The bathroom was a reasonable size but there was a noise every 3 or 4 mins from the wall, some kind of a water sound for all the 4 days we were there. There was a liquid soap dispenser at the basin, one in the bath, 3 towels (no hand towel, no floor towel), nothing else. Oh yes, one dead BIG cockroach which remained just under the toilet seat for all the days we were there. (3) First day, came back to see room not cleaned, bathroom not cleaned, towels not changed but too late in the night to get someone to come in as we just wanted to sleep. (4) Second day, told at the reception to make sure room done, but came back to see the same status. Went back to tell the reception before going out to dinner, were assured it would be done, but when we came back past 10pm, it was still undone. Begged for towels and got them. (5) Third day made a BIG noise and finally it did get done. But the cockroach remained where it had been!!! My advice, don't go there. It offers facilities like a hostel at prices of a good hotel. Its a rip off. Location is the only good thing about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for sleeping after visiting coffee shops”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I stayed there by myself a few years ago, the bathroom was ok, clean sheets and lock on the door was all I needed. I fought a cockroach from picking off of my breakfast plate downstairs. In the night stand, there was a dirty sock and a small plastic bag left behind and I had the "maid" re-vacuum before I headed out to the coffee shops. He did anything that I asked and did it with a smile, a sincere smile. Plus, it helped that he spoke french (I was studying in France at the time) and not much english. It was close to the Red Light District and didn't have far to go back. I would stay there again because it was cheap and when I come back after being in the coffee shops and sight-seeing, I know everything was taken care of in the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Mice - What mice?”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from another trip to Amsterdam (11th - 13th April). We are a group of English Ajax supporters and regularly pop over to Amsterdam for the matches, we also normally stay at the same hotel (the Frisco Inn).However on this occasion my friend was clicking around on the internet and came across a great deal for the Delta hotel through the EasyToBook[-] website.It worked out at around Â£25 each per night INCLUDING breakfast (our other hotel doesn't offer breakfast and we pay 45euro's - Â£31 per night).On this occasion three of us were staying there so I booked the triple room.No matter where I go I always read the reviews on Tripadvisor and after reading the reviews on the Delta hotel we had some serious resevations about staying here,especially reports of mice and cockroaches.But the deal was that good we went ahead.The Delta is virtually opposite our other hotel and is located right on the Damrak just a stones throw from Centraal station,the red light area and Dam square. On arrival we were greeted by the friendly reception staff who processed our booking.We were given the triple room (446) at the rear of the hotel on the fourth floor.When we arrived at the fourth floor we were met by a building site.They were refurbishing all the bedroom toilet/shower rooms and ours seemed to be the only one they had finished.There was boxes of tiles,bags of grouting,builders tools everywhere plus all the carpeting was covoured in sheets of paper.We were not too impressed at this point,however,on entering our room we were quietly surprised.It was very spacious with plenty of room around the beds,lots of storge space,a security safe and a television with free PORN channel!! The shower/toilet room, as expected was brand spanking new and was also quite big which was excellent.Water pressure was superb.If I had one grumble I wished the shower had been in an enclosed cubicle instead of being open plan.When you took a shower everything got wet plus if a mate wanted to use the loo he couldn't - unless he wanted a shower sitting on it!! Beds were comfy and all bed linen was clean.Our room had windows that ran full width of the room which let in plenty of light and all the windows opened for ventilation. Breakfast in the morning was the usual euro fair,scrambled eggs,bacon,beans plus breads and cheeses and cold meats etc.We had no complaints here at all.If there is one thing the hotel could really do with is a good clean up on the outside,it does look rather dirty. All-in-all we had a pleasant two night stay and for the money it was fantastic value and would definitely consider staying here again. I have given my rating a four star on the basis of value for money. Oh, I nearly forgot,we didn't see a mouse or any evidence of mice or cockroaches anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't please all the people all the time...”
Reviews.Author: harveydogUk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the huge discounts offered by some web-sites prior to reading the reviews (something I never normally do). Some of the other reviews are DREADFULL! I therefore had a sense of dread at what to expect. I have to say that the hotel is a basic hotel, but for the price we paid it was great(90 quid for four nights each for a twin room)what more could you want! The location is superb; Central Station and Dam Square within sight, coffee shops bars, cinemas, restaurants etc (oh, and the ace chip shop next door!)all within very easy reach. The room was a good size on the ground floor, good sized bathroom, comfy beds, and even a safe (even though the safe was only attached to a flimsy wardrobe shelf, it still gave you a slight feeling of security!). At the end of the day, in Amsterdam if you don't sleep well at night after being out and about then there is something wrong with you! a mouse could have tap danced on my face most nights and I would have been oblivious! (see a previous review re: mice) I thought overall it was great, and would reccommend it to anyone purely on the price/location ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Delta”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Delta hotel is right on the main strip extending from the train station. It is about a 2-5 min walk to get from the platform to the hotel. It's central location is excellent if you want to pick a direction to go in each day. Dam Square is right down the street and all of the best coffeeshops are right around the corner. We made Cafe 420 our home base, we were sure to check out everywhere, but always seemed to end up back there. We had a 3rd and 5th floor room both facing the street. Each room had one of the most memorable views of the city. Watch early in the morning for the Amstel Horse and Buggy, that is if you are able to get up that early. Probably not the best hotel for business purposes but definately great for those looking for a good time. Beware the elevator, it is only big enough for 1-2 people and their bags and even that is pushing it. Lean too hard on the wall and you can hear it touch the sides of the shaft. We took the stairs most of the time. I cannot wait to return to Amsterdam and the Delta Hotel, hopefully I'll see you there.

Reviews.Title: “not the best-but not the worst!”
Reviews.Author: beckaf-g
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the delta hotel for five nights in early feb 2006. between the 9 of us we had 3 rooms- 2 doubles and a 6 ppl room).our room (one of the doubles) had a huge bathroom but the room was quite small, the other double was tiny! the 6 was quite small, but it was cheap and thats what we expected. never mind- huge bonus is the location- 2 mins walk from central station and dam square and 30 seconds walk from the grasshoper-bonus! all in all we found all the reception staff (bar one-the night shift one) to be really friendly and helpful. they let us check in 2 nours early, also they let us store our luggage all day after we checked out. from the amount of ppl we saw walking around with cases all day everyday-trust me this isn't the norm! if you want a 3* hotel the delta isn't the place for you but it can't be beaten for location and was clean and comfortable. rooms are cleaned every day but are basic- i would return again!dont let the bad reviews put you off!

Reviews.Title: “good for groups!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed here for 2 nights we had the 8 bed room which was a really good size.Its not the lap of luxury but on a budget its worth every penny- good location, comfy beds, relitavely clean and Staff helpful and very friendly- WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT? We did see one of the smaller rooms and it wasnt as good as ours (small and a bit dark ) But would highly recommend this hotel for big groups, we will be returning here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Should Not be a three star, great location though.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How on earth the dutch tourist board awarded this hotel with a three star rating is beyond me! However, the hotel is clean and the beds are relatively comfy. Its quite good value for money, but certainly dont go expecting luxury!!! Staff are average, but location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, Stay well Clear!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrcool76
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this Hotel for a long weekend break. Hereâ€™s the breakdown: Day 1: Checked in the Hotel late Friday Evening, There will charge of â‚¬40 deposit (refundable after when you checked out) this is because you don't trash your hotel room etc. But I understood that. So far so good. Day 2: All hotels guest get free breakfast from 7:30am â€“ 10AM, which was not bad. During naptime, the heater was making an annoying whistling noise every few minutes. I couldnâ€™t sleep. I went down to the reception & explained problem, they did not have any other rooms, so I had to live with it. Day 3: I was moved to another room, in the morning, at night, whilst I was a sleep, I got up to get some water, and to my surpriseâ€¦â€¦I saw 2 mice running around my room, I was shocked & disgusted. So I immediately went to the reception & explained the problem, they moved me straight away to another room (the deluxe suite). I was asked if I was eating in my room, I said no. They said to me I will have to move in the morningâ€¦â€¦NO NOT AGAIN! By the way no eating is allowed in your room!! No wonder! Day 4: That morning the manager apologised for what had happened, and it was OK for me to spend my final night in the Deluxe Suite. There were no problems during that night. During Check-Out, I got any apology from the staff, but I did not get any discounts or reductions Bad Points: - Mice, Noisy Heaters, Bad Showers. Good Points: - In a perfect location, 5 mins from Centraal Station, close to RLD, Dam Square etc, all pretty much in walking distance. I canâ€™t say if I will every stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty, hot room. Took 3 days before they put a fan in the room. Windows opened inwards and you walked into them if you had to go to the toilet during the night. Carpet on the wall? Very strange. Grubby bathroom. Breakfast unusual, okay if you like eating off chipped plates and cups. Certainly not worthy of its 3 stars. Only good thing going for it is location. Have stayed in better 2 stars in Amsterdam. Only book this if its cheap and you're not fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't laugh - this is our FAVORITE hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Jeez, I can't believe all these bad reviews are about my FAVORITE hotel in the world: The Delta Hotel (or as my wife calls it: the Delta House!). We have travelled happily to Amsterdam 7 times and have stayed at the Delta 5 of those times and wished we had the other 2 times. YES the lobby is small (who cares?) but the staff has ALWAYS been more than gracious (ie: making us food & drinks AFTER the restaurant has closed, watched our luggage and chatted cheerfully with us). Grant it, we ALWAYS stay in our favorite room(s) - in particular room 330 or ANY room with the small balcony. These balcony rooms face the Dam (AND we were warned that it can get noisy) but for two people they're HUGE with tall ceilings and, as I mentioned, two french doors that open to a balcony overlooking the Dam. We were able to enjoy the Christmas parade right outside our room (Black Peter even threw candy up to us!). Yeah, breakfast was basic but never cold and I have NEVER seen any mice or critters in our room and the showers/bathrooms seemed no different from any other hotel. This hotel has TONS of personality, sits next door to a killer french fry stand and is a 4 minute walk from central station. By the way, the hotel picture on the websites that shows the sign & the balconies: THAT'S ME STANDING ON THE BALCONY LOOKING OUT! Go to the Delta, just ask for a balcony room facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: JLUCalgaryCanada
Reviews.Content: Good location in the centre of amsterdam, near train station. Staff were friendly and helpful. The problem was cleanliness, particularly in the bathroom. They also added an extra tax of around 40 euros which we weren't aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty dive but close to station”
Reviews.Author: goodship
Reviews.Content: Very central, close to station and Dam square. You have to pay up frount for the loan of a TV remote. The room was small ( I dont really mind that as many are in Amsterdam) the room was dirty and the shower room disgusting, curtains were full of cig burn - not exactly classy but if your looking for a central hotel then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Stag Do. Rooms were OK, although one of our foursomes ended up with the attic room which wasn't fit for storage let alone accommodation. Admittedly, when another room became available they were moved. All was going OK until checkout, when they tried to sting us for phone calls we hadn't made and premium channels we hadn't watched. Needless to say, we refused to pay and they eventually waived the fees. Then, a month after checkout, a mysterious Â£150 charge appeared on my bank statement. They'd taken it upon themselves to debit my account for a tv we allegedly threw on the floor. Absolute rubbish. Currently trying to get this money back from them. In my opinion, although the accommodation was OK, and the location was good, I would never recommend to anyone I know staying here, as it might end up costing you a ----sight more than you bargained for !!

Reviews.Title: “This place stinks! (Literally!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in this hotel, and although we weren't expecting it to be brilliant as we read these reviews (after booking unfortunately), we weren't prepared for the smell! The actual public areas weren't too bad and everwhere seemed reasonably clean (apart from the windows), but when we walked into our small room, we noticed they had opened the window wide (luckily we had one). The room smelled of stale smoke and sweat. It was only when we opened the wardrobe we noticed a brown stained pillow at the bottom and in all honesty i have never smelt anything like it!!I joked that the pillows on the bed probably smelt the same, so we had a look and they were just as bad. The covers were clean, but i dread to think how old the pillows and quilt where. We actually slept on top of the bed, and used our clothes as pillows. Im no snob, but i couldn't bring myself to get in! I agree with the other reviews about the breakfast, edible, but the book "Green Eggs and Ham" springs to mind! I suppose this hotel is Ok for stag does etc, or if you're not fussey about were you sleep, but i wouldn't recommend it, and it certainly put a damper on our trip to Amsterdam. Luckily my husband and myself both have a good sense of humor, and i would say that this is a reqiurement of staying in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great for lads, but I wouldn't take the wife”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for groups of lads but I wouldn't take the wife... The rooms were big enough had a TV and shower and the one we got (top floor) was very quite... The location is excellent and it's handy that there's a amazing bakery just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a group of Lads”
Reviews.Author: Honnymooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Delta in May for my stag night. It was cheap working out around Â£40 per head for a group of 14. If you want a hotel close to everything who will not bother you for having a laugh you will not beat this place. The rooms are not great but it is somewhere to put the head down.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights April/05. Room was tiny with the bed against one wall and 20 cms from the other.Light switch by the door-so to turn off have to walk in dark round corner, up step and climb into bottom of bed. No bedside light. on arrival 2 of the 3 lightbulbs in room were broken. In spite of having booked a "total" price with agency were ripped off to tune of 21.60 euros on leaving. Noisy at night,in scuffy area-chip shop next door. Room and hotel down at heel and dirty. I strongly suggest you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute disgrace!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This joke of a hotel is an absolutely disgraceful rip off and makes a mockery of the Dutch health authorities and tourist inspectors. It's a mouse infested, idiot staffed, poorly managed (if there is one) hell hole. I would seriously warn anybody thinking of staying at the Delta Hotel to consider not only their safety but their health as mice were running freely in our room and mouse droppings are everywhere. The staff don't give a damn and a room maid said they are quite used to the mice. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

Reviews.Title: “not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: JCT41
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 day hen party in Amsterdam. Did not expect the Ritz for the price we paid and our quad bedroom(apart from damp in bathroom) was adequate and clean enough but some other party members had horrific rooms with little or no windows in them and litter scattered around the place. The attitude of the staff is to say the least downright ignorrant it doesn't get you anywhere when you complain because they couldn't care less about you. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so get what you pay for I guess but would not reccommend this hotel to anyone even my enemies! Some customer care wouldn't go amiss with the so called manager. Wouldn't last 5 minutes in this country!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good as a base”
Reviews.Author: SimonWilding
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago but recent reviews suggest not a lot has changed for the better (or indeed the worst). This hotel is perfect for those who want a base in the city centre, close to the train station, who just want somewhere to sleep in between exploring the city. My room was clean, comfortable with good bathroom facilities. The staff were friendly and gave me some good advise when my wallet was pickpocketed in the city - they even let me use their phone to call home (overseas remember) to cancel my credit cards etc. Luckily I had left most of my money in the very handy room safe. Not a place to go with family but for a good value, central hotel for those who are going to spend very little time in their room, it's great. simonwilding@aol.com ipswich UK

Reviews.Title: “GHASTLY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 15-17 January 2005 wobbly WC, cold and inedible breakfast, Shower was either red hot or ice cold in seconds. Not worth the money

HotelInfo.Name: Delta Hotel Amsterdam City Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 42-43, Amsterdam 1012 LK, The Netherlands
